programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features.(n)

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international stories as they break.(n)

programme.title: Sunday Morning Live
programme.desc: Sean Fletcher and Emma Barnett present more topical debate covering religious, moral and ethical issues, with guest panellists and contributions from viewers.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Developers Lucy Alexander and Martin Roberts explore three terraced houses about to be auctioned in London, the Midlands and Devon, before meeting their new owners and hearing their plans for development. Later, the presenters returns to the properties to check on their progress.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Antiques experts Catherine Southon and Paul Laidlaw head to Edinburgh to help teams of forensic scientists and lecturers find potentially profitable items to take to auction. Meanwhile, presenter Tim Wonnacott discovers a clever games table at Saltram House in Devon.(n)

programme.title: Wallace & Gromit: A Grand Day Out
programme.desc: Nick Park's Bafta-winning film which introduced the animated inventor and his faithful canine sidekick to the world. Wallace is distraught when his cheese supplies run out, so he decides to take a trip to the moon. All he needs to do is build himself a rocket. With the voice of Peter Sallis.(n)

programme.title: Frozen
programme.desc: A princess with the power to freeze anything she touches loses control of her abilities and plunges the kingdom into a perpetual winter. She goes into hiding, but her sister remains determined that she can be saved from her own magic and sets off on a quest to find her, aided by a mountain man and a living snowman. Disney animated fantasy adventure, with the voices of Kristen Bell and Idina Menzel.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Nicki Chapman helps a couple with exacting requirements search for a new home in the Cotswolds area of Gloucestershire. Meanwhile, away from the property hunt, the presenter meets up with three Olympic heroes.(n)

programme.title: Songs of Praise
programme.desc: Claire McCollum visits a Merseyside village originally built by a Christian entrepreneur in 1888 to house his employees, and Rev Kate Bottley meets a 13-year-old singer.(n)

programme.title: Pointless Celebrities
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman present another themed edition of the general knowledge quiz, inviting high-profile figures from the world of business. This time, Four Rooms duo Peter Ratcliffe and Jeff Salmon take on Ann Summers Chief Executive Jacqueline Gold and Dragons' Den investor Richard Farleigh, The Apprentice winner Tim Campbell and former rival Saira Khan, and lingerie entrepreneur Michelle Mone and former BBC business correspondent Declan Curry.(n)

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Ellie Harrison investigates the role flowers and plants play in everyday life. She visits a herb garden in Bristol to find out about a common plant that is useful in treating cancer, meets a dye maker who only uses natural plant and flower-based colours, discovers a special kind of pickling, and joins a class of schoolchildren who are cultivating rare orchids.(n)

programme.title: Live Athletics: World Championships
programme.sub-title: World Athletics Championships 2017: Day Three - Evening.
programme.desc: Gabby Logan presents coverage of the third night of events at The London Stadium in Queen Elizabeth Olympic Park. Great Britain's Katarina Johnson-Thompson will conclude her bid for gold in the heptathlon when she competes in the 800m, but she was expected to face stiff competition throughout the seven disciplines from Belgium's Olympic champion Nafissatou Thiam. Plus, medals are decided in the women's pole vault, and semi-finals take place in the men's 400m and 110m hurdles. With analysis from Michael Johnson, Colin Jackson and Denise Lewis, and commentary by Steve Cram, Andrew Cotter, Brendan Foster and Steve Backley, and reports from Ore Oduba and Phil Jones. Coverage continues on BBC2.(n)

programme.title: Poldark
programme.desc: Sir Francis places Ross in charge of a group of volunteers to defend the Cornish coast after Prudie and Tholly catch sight of French ships on the horizon. George returns from parliament and is outraged to discover that Drake is living in the smithy on the edge of Trenwith land. However, Tom Harry is only too happy to take on the task of making sure he does not remain there for long. Emma struggles to reconcile her feelings for Sam with their religious differences, and Hugh continues to court Demelza in secret. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Match of the Day
programme.sub-title: MOTD: Community Shield Highlights: Chelsea v Arsenal.
programme.desc: Chelsea v Arsenal. Manish Bhasin presents action from the traditional curtain-raiser to the top-flight campaign, as the Premier League and FA Cup-winners clash at Wembley Stadium. Arsenal won the cup by defeating today's opponents 2-1 here in the May final, going some way towards making up for a faltering league campaign that saw them miss out on Champions League football for the first time since the 1997/98 season. With analysis from Mark Lawrenson.(n)

programme.title: The Recruit
programme.desc: A highly intelligent computer hacker is persuaded to join the CIA by a shady agent, who lets him think there is a link between the agency and his father's death. He proves he has a natural-born talent for espionage work, but when he is given a top-secret assignment to root out a mole within the training programme, he begins to believe his recruiter's warning that nothing is what it seems. Thriller, starring Al Pacino, Colin Farrell, Bridget Moynahan and Gabriel Macht.(n)

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather.(n)

programme.title: Animal Park Summer Special
programme.desc: Jean Johansson tries to get the Siberian tigers to cool off in their pool, Kate Humble finds out why Longleat's pelican expert has won a major award and Ben Fogle meets some lemurs.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Lucy Alexander inspects a potential renovation project in Folkestone, Kent, while Martin Roberts meets a couple who are starting their lives afresh in a mid-terrace house in Staffordshire. Plus, an opportunity for their right buyer in the form of a disused post office.(n)

programme.title: Matron, Medicine and Me: 70 Years of the NHS
programme.desc: Lucy Alexander is the first of five famous faces examining the history of the NHS, with the TV presenter being reunited with staff who helped save her daughter's life.(n)

programme.title: Rip Off Britain: Food
programme.desc: Julia Somerville, Angela Rippon, and Gloria Hunniford investigate frustrations with food labels and packaging, including some products sold in what seems like half-empty packets.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Experts Nick Hall and Jonathan Pratt help two teams buy three items at Wetherby Racecourse, while presenter Eric Knowles also visits one of the world's oldest sweet shops.(n)

programme.title: Red Rock
programme.desc: A transaction goes wrong for Tommy, Adrijan is dreading his medical report and there is confusion over whether a disappearance is down to mischief or malice.(n)

programme.title: The Code
programme.desc: Matt Allwright hosts the quiz in which contestants must answer questions to help crack a three-digit code that will open a safe full of money. The jackpot starts at £3,000 and each time contestants fail - and that could be after just one wrong answer - they have to leave immediately and another £500 is added to the prize. Matt is assisted by quiz expert Lesley-Anne Brewis.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Nicki Chapman helps a couple from Surrey who are seeking rural home in Dorset for their £350,000 budget, and also heads to the southernmost tip of the county to scale its cliffs.(n)

programme.title: Flog It
programme.desc: People are invited to try to make money out of their antiques by taking a risk at auction.(n)

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz show in which pairs of contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions posed to 100 people before the show. At the end of each round, the team with the most points is eliminated until the final two pairs battle for the chance to compete for a cash prize. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman.(n)

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Actress Martine McCutcheon joins Matt Baker and Alex Jones as they present the first of a week of shows from Northern Ireland at Carrickfergus Castle in Co Antrim.(n)

programme.title: The Bug Grub Couple
programme.desc: Entomologist Sarah Beynon and chef Andy Holcroft embark on a mission to bring insect-based food into the mainstream, promoting it as a more sustainable source of protein than meat. Before pitching to potential buyers, they go to the Netherlands to check that the insect farmers there can supply the quantity and quality of protein that they need and that it is safe for human consumption. Part of the Our Lives strand.(n)

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Linda returns to the Square and throws herself into getting everything back on track, while a nervous Mick toys with the idea of confessing everything that went on with Whitney. Abi confronts Steven for ignoring her, but he assures her it is all part of his plan for them to be together - although Max ensures the young man feels awkward as he discusses his wedding plans with Lauren. Keanu desperately searches for a job and schoolteacher Mr Pryce looks at flats in the area.(n)

programme.title: Live Athletics: World Championships
programme.desc: Gabby Logan presents further coverage of the fourth night of events at The London Stadium in Queen Elizabeth Olympic Park, including the women's 1500m final. Great Britain's Laura Muir will hope to be involved, but could face the likes of Olympic champion Faith Kipyegon and world record-holder Genzebe Dibala. Another Briton who will hope to contend for a medal this evening is 110m hurdler Andrew Pozzi, while the women's triple jump final also takes place. With analysis from Michael Johnson, Colin Jackson and Denise Lewis, and commentary by Steve Cram, Andrew Cotter, Brendan Foster and Steve Backley, and reports from Ore Oduba and Phil Jones.(n)

programme.title: Have I Got Old News for You
programme.desc: Only Connect host Victoria Coren Mitchell takes over the reins of the satirical current affairs quiz in an edition from November 2016. Comedy writer and performer Andy Hamilton and Conservative MP Tim Loughton join team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the week's news.(n)

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.sub-title: Have I Got a Bit More Old News for You.
programme.desc: Black Mirror creator and satirist Charlie Brooker hosts an extended edition of the satirical current affairs quiz from November 2016, with actress Maureen Lipman and comedian Rich Hall joining captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the week's news.(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: The Instant Gardener
programme.desc: Helen Skelton and designer Danny Clarke attempt to transform a stagnant, weed-choked pond into a haven both for its owners and the local wildlife.(n)

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: At Longmeadow, Monty Don plants up a new bed of irises and takes pelargonium cuttings. Nick Bailey brightens up a dull and shady space at the side of a terraced house and gives advice on plants that will thrive. Carol Klein pays the first of two visits to West Yorkshire to meet a couple whose outstanding planting has resulted in a garden full of late summer interest, while Joe Swift takes a look at a sloping and shady town garden to find out how the owner has designed this difficult space. Plus, the Dorset gardener who has created an Italianate idyll, and an in-depth look at the pelargonium.(n)

programme.title: The Beechgrove Garden
programme.desc: Chris Beardshaw plants a range of hostas in the Beechgrove Cottage Garden. Hostas are usually tasty morsels for slugs and snails, so Chris also tries out a range of preventative measures. Plus, George Anderson visits Fiona and Euan Smith's garden at Kierfiold House on Orkney.(n)

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: A look at green spaces and wildlife in urban areas. Anita Rani visits a haven for animals in Stoke Newington, and helps an urban photographer track a pair of nesting common terns. Sean Fletcher joins Manchester airport's environment team, James Wong meets Liverpool residents growing vegetables on their roofs, Tom Heap investigates air pollution, and Adam Henson meets former services personnel rebuilding their lives through farming.(n)

programme.title: Live Athletics: World Championships
programme.sub-title: World Athletics Championships 2017: Day Three - Morning Session.
programme.desc: Gabby Logan presents coverage of the morning session on day three at The London Stadium in Queen Elizabeth Olympic Park, including the long jump and javelin disciplines of the heptathlon. Plus, medals are decided in the men's and women's marathons, while Great Britain's European Indoor champion Andrew Pozzi begins his bid for glory in the 110m hurdles. Also taking place is qualifying for the men's pole vault, and the heats of the men's 400m hurdles and women's 400m. With commentary by Steve Cram, Brendan Foster, Andrew Cotter, Steve Backley and Toni Minichiello, and analysis from Michael Johnson, Denise Lewis and Colin Jackson.(n)

programme.title: Britain's Ancient Capital: Secrets of Orkney
programme.desc: An investigation into how recent archaeological finds on the archipelago indicate that Orkney was the cultural capital of Stone Age Britain and the birthplace of the stone circle cult. Chris Packham uncovers the secrets revealed by the DNA of Orkney's unique vole, Neil Oliver explores tombs and monuments, Shini Somara experiments to discover how ancient Orcadians could have moved giant blocks of stone over rough ground, and Andy Torbet climbs a challenging sea-stack to unlock the story of Orkney's unusual geology.(n)

programme.title: Steve Backshall's Extreme Mountain Challenge
programme.desc: Part one of two. The naturalist leads a team of rock climbers across Venezuela's tepuis - sheer-sided mountains surrounded by jungle. In the first episode, he attempts an ascent of a rockface that has never been climbed previously to discover what kind of animals live at the summit. However, to get there he will have to brave wildlife, rapids and a run-in with a rickety biplane.(n)

programme.title: Inside the Factory
programme.desc: Gregg Wallace investigates Europe's largest biscuit factory in London, while Cherry Healey looks into the chocolate added to the beloved digestive. Plus, Ruth Goodman examines the link between biscuits and digestion.(n)

programme.title: Secrets of Silicon Valley
programme.desc: Part one of two. Jamie Bartlett investigates how technology companies are shaping the future of the world, and the potential negative consequences of the drive towards progress. He visits Hyderabad, where the utopian vision promoted by Uber has left many drivers on the brink of suicide, questions the impact of more jobs becoming automated, and meets a former executive who fears social breakdown and the collapse of capitalism.(n)

programme.title: Live Athletics: World Championships
programme.sub-title: World Athletics Championships 2017: Day Three - Evening.
programme.desc: Gabby Logan presents further coverage of the third night of events at The London Stadium in Queen Elizabeth Olympic Park, including the women's 100m final, which was won by Jamaica's Olympic champion Elaine Thompson two years ago. Plus, the men's shot put final concludes, and the men's 800m semi-finals take place. With analysis from Michael Johnson, Colin Jackson and Denise Lewis, commentary by Steve Cram, Andrew Cotter, Brendan Foster and Steve Backley, and reports from Ore Oduba.(n)

programme.title: Gareth Thomas v Homophobia: Hate in the Beautiful Game
programme.desc: Fifty years since homosexual acts between consenting male adults were decriminalised, former Wales and Lions rugby union captain Gareth `Alfie' Thomas takes a personal look at what he sees as the last bastion of open homophobia in sport - professional football. Only one professional male player, Justin Fashanu, has come out while playing the game. He killed himself in 1998. What is preventing gay footballers from coming out? Gareth meets players, fans and managers in a bid to find out.(n)

programme.title: Golf: Women's British Open
programme.sub-title: Golf: Women's Open Highlights: 2017 Day Four.
programme.desc: Eilidh Barbour presents action from the fourth and final day of the event, which this year was staged at Kingsbarns Golf Links in Fife.(n)

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: A look at green spaces and wildlife in urban areas. Anita Rani visits a haven for animals in Stoke Newington, and helps an urban photographer track a pair of nesting common terns. Sean Fletcher joins Manchester airport's environment team, James Wong meets Liverpool residents growing vegetables on their roofs, Tom Heap investigates air pollution, and Adam Henson meets former services personnel rebuilding their lives through farming.(n)

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Newly appointed and keen to impress, Nina is intent on an innovative path and strikes a deal with a face from the past - but may yet come to regret it. Party animal Morven is determined to remain professional despite a number of obstacles, but then makes a regretful decision. When Sacha boasts about his new `lady friend', the team members are eager to meet her, but none are prepared for what unfolds on Keller ward.(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: The TV That Made Me
programme.desc: Kirsty Wark looks back at significant TV from her past, including favourite childhood show The Man from Uncle and her own famous interview with Margaret Thatcher.(n)

programme.title: Animal Park Summer Special
programme.desc: The penguin keepers embark on their most ambitious project to date, building an underwater feeding machine, while a hyrax is rushed to the vet for some emergency dental work.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Charlie Ross presents from the market town of Newark, Nottinghamshire, as experts Philip Serrell and Charles Hanson help two teams scour an antiques fair seeking items to sell for profit at auction. Plus, Charlie finds out more about the extraordinary story of TE Lawrence, better known as Lawrence of Arabia.(n)

programme.title: The Sheriffs Are Coming
programme.desc: The officers deal with a large group of squatters who have barricaded themselves inside a building in south London, Tommy and Craig meet a dealer who sold a potentially lethal second-hand car, and Lawrence and Kev face the prospect of seizing some heavy machinery in place of a large debt.(n)

programme.title: Victoria Derbyshire
programme.desc: Daily news and current-affairs programme offering discussion of breaking stories, exclusive interviews and audience interaction via social media.(n)

programme.title: BBC Newsroom Live
programme.desc: A chance to stay up to date on the day's leading stories, with the latest breaking news as it happens.(n)

programme.title: Golf: Women's British Open
programme.sub-title: Golf: Women's Open Highlights: 2017 Day Four.
programme.desc: Eilidh Barbour presents action from the fourth and final day of the event, which this year was staged at Kingsbarns Golf Links in Fife.(n)

programme.title: Triathlon
programme.sub-title: Triathlon World Series Highlights: 2017 ITU World Triathlon Series: Montreal, Canada.
programme.desc: Action from the seventh round of the ITU World Triathlon Series in Montreal, Canada, featuring the men's elite race.(n)

programme.title: A Taste of Britain
programme.desc: Janet Street-Porter and Brian Turner travel to Monmouthshire, where they begin their trip at Kymin Hill, overlooking the county town of Monmouth. Their first gastronomic stop is at the home of an award-winning charcuterie producer, where Brian makes lamb sausages with pickled cabbage. The duo then visit a vineyard and taste the distinctive wine of the region, before taking a tour of the area's landmarks and trying their hands at beekeeping.(n)

programme.title: Patagonia: Earth's Secret Paradise
programme.desc: A glimpse at the rarely seen South American wilderness, home to a range of creatures from terrain as varied as the Andes to Cape Horn. Cameras reveal the secret lives of pumas and hummingbirds, soar with condors over glacial peaks and explore monkey puzzle forests dating back to the time of the dinosaurs. The extreme kayakers who gain thrills and excitement from traversing the area's raging waterfalls are observed, as are the native cowboys, known as gauchos, as they round up wild horses. Narrated by Santiago Cabrera.(n)

programme.title: The Life of Mammals
programme.desc: David Attenborough explores the world of omnivores, nature's generalists, revealing their myriad talents in the wild and how some species have adapted to man's encroachment into their habitats by making their homes in cities and towns.(n)

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Antiques experts Mark Stacey and Will Axon travel through East Sussex in their search for bargains, beginning in Hastings before battling it out at auction in Lewes. Narrated by Tim Wonnacott.(n)

programme.title: Live Athletics: World Championships
programme.sub-title: World Athletics Championships 2017: Day Four - Evening.
programme.desc: Gabby Logan presents coverage of the fourth night of events at The London Stadium in Queen Elizabeth Olympic Park, including the final of the women's hammer throw. Team GB's Sophie Hitchon made history last summer by becoming the first British woman to win an Olympic medal in this event, and she will be hoping to become Britain's first-ever World Championships hammer medallist, male or female. With analysis from Michael Johnson, Colin Jackson and Denise Lewis, commentary by Steve Cram, Andrew Cotter, Brendan Foster and Steve Backley, and reports from Ore Oduba. Coverage continues on BBC1.(n)

programme.title: Nadiya's British Food Adventure
programme.desc: Nadiya Hussain samples what London has to offer, heading to Beckton in the east of the city to visit an indoor urban farm in an industrial estate that uses hydroponics and aquaponics to rear fish and grow vegetables. She then heads north to Holloway, to meet chef Pratap Chatal, who runs supper clubs in his home where he showcases his revolutionary idea of cooking his food with fragrances.(n)

programme.title: Man in an Orange Shirt
programme.desc: In the present day, Flora finds her demons return when her vet grandson Adam tentatively forms a relationship with his client Steve, but a minefield of internalised issues and dangerous temptations still line the road to the happiness of them all. When the discovery of a lost painting by Thomas March brings things to a head, can Flora reconcile her past with her grandson's future? And is Adam brave enough to choose love? Concluding part of Patrick Gale's drama, starring Vanessa Redgrave, Julian Morris and David Gyasi.(n)

programme.title: Athletics: World Championships Highlights
programme.desc: Gabby Logan and Ore Oduba present analysis of the fourth night of events at The London Stadium in Queen Elizabeth Olympic Park, where four finals took place. Michael Johnson offers his input.(n)

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Evan Davis.(n)

programme.title: Coming Oot! The Fabulous History of Gay Scotland
programme.desc: Documentary using eyewitness testimony, archive footage and historical research to examine the post-war history of Scotland's gay community, charting the Scottish public's radically changing attitudes over the past 70 years. Scotland was over a decade behind England and Wales in decriminalising homosexuality but now has the best gay rights in Europe: nothing short of a revolution.(n)

programme.title: BBC Proms 2017
programme.desc: Suzy Klein and Lloyd Coleman introduce a concert by the National Youth Orchestra of Great Britain, conducted by composer Thomas Ades. The performance features Stravinsky's The Rite of Spring and the London premiere of new works by Francisco Coll and Ades himself.(n)

programme.title: The Richard Burton Diaries
programme.desc: Actor Richard Burton became a superstar of stage and screen thanks to his talent, presence and unforgettable voice - but he was equally famous for his hell-raising, womanising and his two marriages to Elizabeth Taylor. This documentary reassesses the man behind the myth using private diaries he wrote at the height of his fame.(n)

programme.title: Frank Skinner on George Formby
programme.desc: The comedian presents a profile of the entertainer, who was arguably the biggest star in Britain during the 1930s and 40s. Skinner explores why Formby's films and records enjoyed unprecedented commercial success both in the UK and abroad, and performs a selection of the songs that made him famous - as well as investigating the circumstances surrounding his sudden death.(n)

programme.title: Babs
programme.desc: Biopic of Barbara Windsor, following the key events of her life over the course of 50 years. The story begins in 1993, with the actress preparing for a stage performance, before flashing back to her childhood as a lonely evacuee in the Second World War, her rise to fame in the Carry On films and her difficult relationships with her father and her first husband, gangster Ronnie Knight. Samantha Spiro, Jaime Winstone and Windsor herself share the lead role.(n)

programme.title: Timeshift
programme.sub-title: Timeshift: Bouffants, Beehives and Bobs - The Hairstyles That Shaped Britain.
programme.desc: A look back at the iconic hairdos people in Britain have flirted with over the past 60 years. From the meringue-like confections of Raymond `Teasy Weasy', via the geometric bob cuts of Vidal Sassoon, to the big-hair heyday of bouffants and beehives - not forgetting the mullet and the 1970s perms. Part of the Timeshift documentary strand.(n)

programme.title: Capability Brown's Unfinished Garden
programme.desc: Bunny Guinness tries to carry out the 18th-century English landscape designer's plans for his own garden in Fenstanton, Cambridgeshire. Brown travelled the length and breadth of the country, improving more than 200 of the greatest estates in the land, for some of the most influential people of the day, but the design for his own garden never got off the drawing board.(n)

programme.title: Timeshift
programme.sub-title: Timeshift: How to Be a Lady - An Elegant History.
programme.desc: Rachel Johnson embarks on a quest to find out how to be a lady. The writer and former editor of the Lady magazine explores the origins of the word `lady', from the time when it represented a specific code of behaviour, dress and speech, to the current day, asking why terms such as `ladylike' remain in use. As part of her mission, Rachel rides side-saddle, attends an etiquette school and visits her grandmother's own Ladies' College at Cheltenham.(n)

programme.title: Frank Skinner on George Formby
programme.desc: The comedian presents a profile of the entertainer, who was arguably the biggest star in Britain during the 1930s and 40s. Skinner explores why Formby's films and records enjoyed unprecedented commercial success both in the UK and abroad, and performs a selection of the songs that made him famous - as well as investigating the circumstances surrounding his sudden death.(n)

programme.title: World News Today
programme.desc: The day's leading stories.(n)

programme.title: The Boats That Built Britain
programme.desc: Writer Tom Cunliffe turns his attention to the Reaper, the biggest sailing lugger ever to fish the seas at 70ft long, and capable of pulling in 10 tons of herring in a single haul. He learns about the origins and history of the vessel, which played an important role in supplying food to Britain after the Second World War.(n)

programme.title: Tornado: The 100mph Steam Engine
programme.desc: Cameras following the fortunes of new A1 class steam engine Tornado as it tries to achieve 100mph on the main line, a secret attempt made in the middle of the night.(n)

programme.title: The Return of Flying Scotsman
programme.desc: Cameras follow one of the world's most famous locomotives as it returns to the tracks following a 10-year restoration that cost more than £4 million. Enthusiasts and supporters are aboard as the train sets off from London's King's Cross Station on a journey to York and its new home at the National Railway Museum. John Shrapnel narrates.(n)

programme.title: Vikings
programme.desc: Neil Oliver explores the history of the Norse warriors, delving into their customs and searching for the truth behind their fearsome reputation. He begins by telling the story of their origins, and investigates the world of their ancient ancestors. The programme charts Scandinavia's prehistoric landscape, from the Baltic Sea to Norway's Atlantic coast, and Neil examines archaeological evidence to create a portrait of the society from which the Vikings emerged.(n)

programme.title: Nelson's Caribbean Hell-Hole: An Eighteenth Century Navy Graveyard Uncovered
programme.desc: After the discovery of human bones on a beach in Antigua, historian Sam Willis investigates one of the darkest chapters of Britain's imperial past. As archaeologists excavate a mass grave of British soldiers, he explores the island's ruins and discovers how the sugar islands of the Caribbean were rife with sun, sea, war, tropical diseases and poisoned rum.(n)

programme.title: Sex and Sensibility: The Allure of Art Nouveau
programme.desc: Stephen Smith examines the influence art nouveau had on British art and design in the early part of the 20th century. He explores the work of illustrator Aubrey Beardsley and architect and designer Charles Rennie Mackintosh, as well as delving into the careers of less celebrated figures, including Mackintosh's wife Margaret MacDonald and artist and craftswoman Mary Watts. Smith also considers how entrepreneur Arthur Liberty helped popularise the art nouveau style through his London department store.(n)

programme.desc: The body of a Navy lieutenant is found on the side of a remote road and toxicology tests reveal he died of overhydration. programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Homeland Security employee Victor Sterling mysteriously disappears and his car is found at a drive-through restaurant that becomes the scene of a double murder. American naval crime drama, starring Mark Harmon, Joe Spano, Tom Gallop and Melinda McGraw.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Part one of two. A military aircraft transporting the bodies of dead US marines back home crashes before reaching its destination, and Gibbs and the team are called in to help identify human remains at the site of the wreckage. However, a DNA discrepancy turns a routine investigation into a search for a missing person. Crime drama, starring Mark Harmon.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Part two of two. Ziva and Gibbs lead the mission to rescue the captured Marine in Afghanistan before discovering that her captor's brothers have bigger plans and are at large in America. programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Tony is forced to tackle a case with a personal element when his father is discovered drunk in a car that has a dead body in the boot. American drama, starring Michael Weatherly, with Nadia Bjorlin.(n)

Drama, starring Mark Harmon and Pauley Perrette.(n)

programme.desc: The team members are surprised when Gibbs asks DiNozzo's father to join them in their investigation of a murder committed at the US Naval Academy. Guest starring Robert Wagner.(n)

programme.desc: Part one of two. Ziva confronts her past when the team is ordered to protect her father, Mossad director Eli David, at a gathering of former heads of NCIS. Drama, guest starring TJ Ramini and Michael Nouri, with Cote de Pablo and Michael Weatherly.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Part two of two. The safe house is attacked, leaving Vance in hospital and Eli missing, with his bodyguard Amit Hadar dead. Drama, starring Michael Nouri, Cote de Pablo, Rocky Carroll and Mark Harmon.(n)

programme.title: Shark Tank
programme.desc: Episode 312. Pitches in the Season 3 finale include a residential lock system that incorporates a key into a mobile phone; a home gym with nitrogen-gas pressure as resistance; antiaging products inspired by their developer's older girlfriend; and recycled sneakers. Also: an update on a Web site that sells VIP treatment at nightclubs and special events(n)

programme.title: Shark Tank
programme.desc: Episode 605. Entrepreneurs include the owner of an all-female golf caddy company; a couple who believe they have come up with a better, safer way for kids to bounce; and a trio who pitch to the Sharks their fun spin on a classic faceware accessory. Also: an update on Mark Cuban's $2 million investment in the Los Angeles Haunted Hayride during Season 4(n)

programme.title: Shark Tank
programme.desc: Episode 726. A heated exchange takes place in the Season 7 finale when a Shark's temper is lost after an entrepreneur refuses an offer "for personal reasons." Other highlights include a line of healthy treats made just for women; a rare second chance to strike a deal; and updates on some viewer favorites(n)

programme.title: Shark Tank
programme.desc: Episode 715. A Shark declares one pitchperson would drive them nuts. Products include a breath freshener with dual uses; a functional kid's placemat; and an "ugly" produce subscription service. Also: a follow-up on the Houston-based founders of LuminAID solar inflatable lights, which Mark Cuban invested in during Season 6(n)

programme.title: Shark Tank
programme.desc: Episode 606. The Sharks consider a business idea for affordable wedding cakes brought to them by a mother and son from Grand Rapids, Mich. Also: a Houston restaurateur with a solution to a common problem encountered while dining out; and an update on a screen repair fix-it kit that Lori invested in during Season 5(n)

programme.title: Shark Tank
programme.desc: Episode 509. A record is broken by one lucky entrepreneur, who accepts an unprecedented amount for a deal, while a producer of Halloween attractions takes some heat for overvaluing her business. Also: a repair wrap from two men in Utah; a product designed to help communicate feelings; and an update on fishing bobbers made from shotgun shells, which Mark invested in during Season 4(n)

programme.title: Shark Tank
programme.desc: Episode 523. The Sharks hear pitches for energy bars fortified with protein from crickets; a garage lock made to protect homes from easy break-ins; a shower cap that offers a solution to "bedhead"; and an e-commerce platform for textbook rentals. Also: an update on Lori's investment in FiberFix adhesive tape(n)

programme.title: Shark Tank
programme.desc: Episode 610. programme.desc: When a new couple move into the neighbourhood, Vanessa invites them over for dinner. programme.title: Cycling
programme.desc: Action from the event held in the Castellon region of Spain, featuring a 200km course with 6,500m of climbing on the slopes of Mount Penyagolosa, the `Stone Giant' of local myth.(n)

programme.title: Motor Sport on 4
programme.sub-title: Motor Sport: Armoy Road Race Build-Up.
programme.desc: Documentary looking at the history of the annual event held in Armoy, Co Antrim.(n)

programme.title: Motor Sport on 4
programme.desc: Action from the annual event, which was set to feature some of the biggest names in motorcycling as they descended on Armoy, Co Antrim.(n)

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: The radio station's new manager disagrees with everything Frasier says - and when the shrink objects to her ideas, he finds his show rescheduled at two o'clock in the morning. Comedy, guest starring Mercedes Ruehl, with Kelsey Grammer.(n)

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Niles suggests he and Frasier set up practice together - but after a series of disasters, they end up in need of therapy themselves. Comedy, guest starring Milo O'Shea, with Kelsey Grammer and David Hyde Pierce.(n)

programme.title: Sunday Brunch
programme.desc: Tim Lovejoy and Simon Rimmer are joined by guests Blake Harrison, John Gordon Sinclair, Kimberly Wyatt and Evanna Lynch. With music from Rat Boy.(n)

programme.title: George Clarke's Amazing Spaces
programme.desc: George travels to the Cornish village of Charlestown, where Charlotte and Joey have bought a public loo that they are planning to turn into a luxury clifftop holiday home - at a cost of £65,000. He also meets a Bristol family who are making their own safari tent, completes his tour of New Zealand with a visit to an underground house, and he and Will Hardie finally unveil their prototype futuristic home.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Marge tries to bring culture to Springfield by asking architect Frank Gehry (guest starring as himself) to construct a concert hall. However, none of the locals is interested, so Mr Burns decides to turn the disused building into a prison, where Homer soon finds himself confined.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Homer is committed to a mental institution by an exasperated Marge, who refuses to believe his improbable tales about befriending a mysterious roofing contractor and fears he is finally cracking up. With the guest voices of Ray Romano and Stephen Hawking.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.sub-title: The Father, the Son and the Holy Guest Star.
programme.desc: Bart begins attending a Catholic school and meets a hip-hop-quoting priest who encourages him to convert. Homer tries to return his son to the Protestant Church, but the lure of beer and a pancake dinner causes him to change his faith - so Reverend Lovejoy and Ned Flanders take action. With the guest voice of Liam Neeson.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Moe becomes a successful poet with Lisa's help, and wins the approval of a group of highbrow authors - but enjoys the limelight so much that he claims all the credit for himself, prompting her to seek revenge.(n)

programme.title: UEFA Euro 2017 Live
programme.sub-title: UEFA Women's Euro 2017: The Final Live.
programme.desc: Netherlands v Denmark (Kick-off 4.00pm). Coverage of the showpiece match, which takes place at FC Twente Stadion in Enschede, the Netherlands. After three weeks of intense competition, this match will determine who lifts the trophy, which has been won by the Germans for a remarkable five previous tournaments in succession. The host nation progressed to this showpiece match following a 3-0 victory over England in the semi-finals, while Denmark had to rely on a penalty shootout to overcome Austria, following a goalless draw after extra time. Subsequent programmes are subject to change.(n)

programme.title: Channel 4 News
programme.desc: Including sport and weather.(n)

programme.title: The Mystery of the Crossrail Skulls
programme.desc: Documentary examining the discovery of dozens of Roman-era skulls by engineers working beneath London's Liverpool Street station. The remains have been identified as dating back to Roman times, but it has yet to be determined who these people were and how their heads ended up buried on the site. Archaeologists examine the bones for evidence of the various theories that have been suggested, questioning whether the skulls belonged to gladiators, executed rebels or the victims of a massacre, or formed part of a grisly ritual.(n)

programme.title: Diana: In Her Own Words
programme.desc: Documentary featuring never-before-seen footage of Diana, Princess of Wales, recorded by her speech consultant between 1992 and 1993 as she sought to define her public persona and present her own version of events reported in the press, touching on her marriage and experience of public life. The programme also features in-depth interviews with people close to her.(n)

programme.title: The King's Speech
programme.desc: The younger son of George V struggles to cope with an uncontrollable stammer, prompting his wife to enlist the aid of an eccentric Australian speech therapist. The support and friendship of the doctor prove invaluable when a crisis places the repressed prince on the throne, just as the outbreak of the Second World War leaves the country in need of a strong king. Oscar-winning fact-based drama, starring Colin Firth, Geoffrey Rush, Helena Bonham Carter and Guy Pearce.(n)

programme.title: The Anomaly
programme.desc: A traumatised former soldier wakes up in a strange place with no memory of how he got there, and immediately finds his life is in danger. As he goes on the run, he finds more sections of his memory being erased and discovers a sinister conspiracy. Sci-fi thriller, directed by and starring Noel Clarke, with Ian Somerhalder and Brian Cox.(n)

programme.title: 60 Days in Jail
programme.desc: Hazing, drug use and violence envelop Clark County Jail as two of the eight participants find themselves on the brink of dropping out of the sheriff's programme.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer assist two couples in their search for homes in Hertfordshire. Newly engaged accountants Liz and Neil are hoping to raise a family near the town of Tring, while in St Albans, married couple David and Claire want to find a place where they can finally settle down, after moving house five times in five years.(n)

programme.title: Selling Houses with Amanda Lamb
programme.desc: Three homeowners in Luton compete to sell their homes to picky buyers Sakander and Lia, after visiting each other's homes and spending £1,000 on improvements, as well as taking tips from the host. Mother and daughter Denise and Gaby transform a teenager's bedroom and make an open-plan kitchen and dining area, while Jeff and Jane address storage issues and a garage conversion, and Binu and Asha revamp their tired living room.(n)

programme.title: Gillette World Sport
programme.desc: An interview with Usain Bolt ahead of the World Athletics Championships, plus action from the latest round of the World Rally Championship in Finland.(n)

programme.title: KOTV Boxing Weekly
programme.desc: Action from a bout featuring Frankie Gavin, plus an archive fight involving Mike Tyson from 1987.(n)

programme.title: Shipping Wars UK
programme.desc: Shahbaz wins the bid for shipping a Piaggio tuk tuk worth £3,000 going more than 500 miles from Dundee to Sevenoaks, while Raymond and Grant transport a pair of swan pedalo boats from Ripon in North Yorkshire to Allum Bay on the Isle of Wight - only to be surprised when there is only one swan at the pick-up location.(n)

programme.title: Countdown
programme.desc: Nick Hewer and Rachel Riley present the long-running words-and-numbers game as naturalist and broadcaster Kate Humble joins Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner.(n)

programme.title: Will & Grace
programme.desc: One of Karen's embittered former classmates tries to take over Walker Inc to get her back for ruining his final year in high school. Meanwhile, Grace and Will take the day off and jump to conclusions when they spot Vince with a colleague. Jeff Goldblum guest stars.(n)

programme.title: Will & Grace
programme.desc: Will's boss invites him to dinner so she can decide whether he deserves to be made a partner in the firm, but he is reluctant to bring Vince as his date. Karen refuses to believe Rosario when she claims to be feeling ill. Lily Tomlin guest stars, with Eric McCormack and Megan Mullally.(n)

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Part two of two. The Barones continue reminiscing about their courtship and wedding, recalling Ray's marriage proposal and the subsequent uncertainty over Debra's motive for accepting. Afraid she may have felt pressured, he decides to give her a second opportunity to reject him.(n)

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: The Barones are forced to stay with Ray's parents while their home is fumigated, providing Debra with the perfect opportunity to turn the tables by interfering in Frank and Marie's lives. Comedy, starring Ray Romano and Patricia Heaton.(n)

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: The family prepares to mourn a relative's death, and while Frasier and Niles organise the funeral in their usual hopeless style, Martin tries to finish a song he began writing for Frank Sinatra. Comedy, starring Kelsey Grammer.(n)

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Kate encourages Bulldog to continue his audience-grabbing practical jokes against Frasier, who decides to exact a suitable revenge - blissfully unaware that such pranks have a nasty habit of backfiring. Comedy, starring Kelsey Grammer and Dan Butler.(n)

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: The shrink is up for a prestigious title at his wine club and offers to host the next tasting in his apartment. Determined to get everything just right, he hires contractors to fix a scratch on the floor - then watches in horror as they wreck the place. Comedy, starring Kelsey Grammer.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard and Amy are forced to take an unexpected road trip to Arizona to pick up Sheldon after his epic railway journey ends in chaos. Meanwhile, Howard finds Stuart's relationship with his mother strange, and Penny has an interview for a sales job at Bernadette's workplace. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon is forced to teach a course at the university, and Howard surprises the gang when he decides to enrol on it. Meanwhile, Amy plays Penny and Bernadette off against each other while the tension brews over Penny's new job. Comedy, guest starring Regina King (Southland), with Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Marge begins a crusade to clean up TV, convinced The Itchy & Scratchy Show is turning baby Maggie into a thug. The show's creators agree to make it less violent in future, but the move has a disastrous effect on its ratings.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Bart pulls out all the stops to pass a school exam, determined to avoid the humiliating prospect of being held back a year - but finds he is not cut out for a life of constant study.(n)

programme.title: Channel 4 News Summary
programme.desc: Includes news headlines, sport and weather.(n)

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Three couples in north Somerset show off their culinary and hosting skills, Norman and Dee kick things off with an Indian menu that proves too spicy for their guests, followed by young lovebirds Ashley and Sophie - although Ashley lets the side down with an un-ironed shirt. Finally, self-styled funnyman Brett and his wife Vicky end the week with an American menu.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawn
programme.desc: High-end pawnbroker James Constantinou faces rare items that are allegedly from Arctic explorer Ernest Shackleton's expeditions and values some vintage Chanel handbags. He also discovers a problem when he takes assistant Jo out for a terrifying test drive in a client's Porsche.(n)

programme.title: The Question Jury

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Summer Sun

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition kicks off at the Cholmeley Arms in Burton-le-Coggles, Lincolnshire, where chef John Berry and his wife Lesley hold a sausage-making competition for their guests.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: DJ Trishna hosts the first of week of dinner parties in Cardiff, hoping her hip-hop-themed night impresses guests Yuno, Nick, Michelle and Suzanne as she tries to win the £1,000.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: The owner of the local comic-book shop suffers a heart attack, so Bart and Milhouse take his place behind the counter while he recuperates - and prove to have a real knack for commerce.(n)

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Cindy is alarmed over news of Armstrong, and Dirk has a plan. Zack feels under pressure, while Hunter and Neeta's day out is ruined. Meanwhile, Luke covers for Darren.(n)

programme.title: Channel 4 News
programme.desc: Including sport and weather.(n)

programme.title: Animal Rescue Live: Supervet Special
programme.desc: New series. Professor Noel Fitzpatrick, Steve Jones and Kate Quilton host an appeal running every night until Friday as they embark on a quest to rehome all the animals in Newcastle Dog & Cat Shelter, attempting to encourage people to consider them first over buying a pet. Many more rescue centres across the country are also taking part and the team will be helping would-be pet owners find their perfect playmate. In the first edition, singer Leona Lewis shares her love of giving shelter animals a second chance in life.(n)

programme.title: 999: What's Your Emergency
programme.desc: Following the criminalisation of formerly legal highs, crack and heroin use is on the up in Wiltshire - and some of the users seem to be getting younger and a routine stop and search uncovers a bag of crack cocaine in the possession of a boy still in his teens. Meanwhile, PC Luke Hobbs leads his first drugs raid on a suspected heroin and crack supplier in Swindon's city centre, discovering the property has been commandeered by a dealer from London who is using the address as a base to make a move into the local market.(n)

programme.title: Eden
programme.desc: In March 2016, 23 men and women left everyday life behind to live in a remote part of the Highlands, where they would be given the chance to start again and create a new society from scratch. Their first months were shown on Channel 4 in 2016 and this catch-up follows their remaining time in Eden, to find out how the dream turned into a nightmare as by the summer hunger was rife and divisions within the camp already becoming apparent as Anton and Raph separated themselves and continue building a winter camp in the woods.(n)

programme.title: 60 Days in Jail
