programme.desc: Ina Garten offers cookery tips and makes dinner for a Broadway producer and his guest - film director Mel Brooks.(n)

programme.desc: Ina Garten prepares breakfast food, including omelette and banana bran muffins.(n)

programme.title: Barefoot Contessa

programme.desc: Ree Drummond makes a Tex-Mex dinner for cowboy Pete and his family, with the menu including carnitas, mango salad, cheesy refried bean casserole, and guacamole with a kick.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond prepares kicked-up spicy wings, make-ahead sandwich rolls, a potato skins bar and salted pretzel brownies for her football crazy sons and their friends.(n)

programme.sub-title: Kitchen Confessional: Four Seasons On The Ranch.
programme.desc: Ree Drummond makes red wine pot roast, chicken tacos with strawberry salsa, roasted beet and goat cheese salad, and carrot and squash curry soup.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond whips up chocolate treats, including white chocolate raspberry cheesecake, dipped and decorated waffle cones, milk chocolate mousse, and a chocolate orange martini.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: Chef Jamie Oliver cooks three dishes to show the versatility of beans, using legumes he picked from his garden - home-made baked borlotti beans, a hearty runner bean stew and a marinated French bean salad.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver focuses on dishes containing onions, garlic and leeks, using them to produce simple meals including a salad, soup, and roast pork with an onion and potato al forno. He also chats to a gardener about the health benefits of raw garlic.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver uses a variety of carrots in an Indian salad, demonstrates how they can be used to complement a pork chop and discovers why the vegetable is orange. He then prepares foil-roasted smoked beetroot with beef and a cottage cheese dressing.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: Chef Jamie Oliver rustles up simple, seasonal dishes and demonstrates how to cook using home-grown potatoes. programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver cooks using peppers and chillies. The menu includes a spicy pork goulash and an experimental dish of smoked salmon with a zingy salsa. He also joins Brian for a taste-test of the hottest chilli in the world - and it is the loyal gardener who keeps his cool.(n)

programme.title: Jamie and Jimmy's Friday Night Feast

programme.desc: The team help the owner of Catharsis restaurant, Miami, as they have recently received complaints of theft and inappropriate behaving during a Dining in the Dark event.(n)

programme.title: Restaurant Stakeout
programme.desc: A restaurant owner appeals for help to save his Italian restaurant after his staff have created a bad atmosphere, and his business is suffering.(n)

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy's digging into a food truck that dishes out pulled pork in Baltimore and a seaside shack with shrimp fritters.(n)

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy's checks out an Italian place cooking veal in Key Largo, Florida, and a local legend serving up Puerto Rican favourites in San Francisco.(n)

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy crosses the country to eat an eclectic mix of dishes from a Mexican restaurant, a local landmark and a New Orleans-inspired spot.(n)

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy Fieri travels through California and Florida and visits a real-deal butchery, plus a funky food truck and a seafood staple.(n)

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy Fieri visits a vegan joint in California, and heads to a carnivore's paradise in Florida.(n)

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy Fieri hits culinary hot spots in South Beach in Florida, including an authentic German joint and a poolside oasis.(n)

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: Barefoot Contessa
programme.desc: American chef and cookbook writer Ina Garten makes an anniversary dinner for her husband, Jeffrey, including coq au vin and garlic mashed potatoes.(n)

programme.title: Barefoot Contessa
programme.desc: American chef and cookbook writer Ina Garten throws a surprise baby shower, with Greek gazpacho, baked salmon nicoise and pecan shortbread on the menu.(n)

programme.title: Barefoot Contessa
programme.desc: American chef and cookbook writer Ina Garten cooks striped bass and couscous with pine nuts for a group of food-lovers.(n)

programme.title: Barefoot Contessa
programme.desc: American chef and cookbook writer Ina Garten throws a holiday dinner party for friends, featuring halibut, shrimp in a saffron sauce and a seafood gratin of lobster.(n)

programme.desc: The chef introduces a selection of classic recipes that never go out of style.(n)

programme.title: Anna Olson: Fresh
programme.desc: Anna prepares a weekend brunch menu, including a breakfast bread pudding made from slices of French toast, bananas and custard.(n)

programme.title: The Healthy Gourmet
programme.desc: It's a face-off with a women's hockey team. Will Ezra and Julie be able to score in the kitchen by offering easy-to-prepare meals for these active ladies who like to play hard?.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree cooks up four sensational 16-minute meals for summer. On the menu is coriander lime salmon, a Greek feast to-go, perfect pasta with pesto and peas, and super-fast courgette noodles for a solo summertime supper.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree demonstrates three chicken dishes, including slow cooker chicken and broccoli, chicken pie and a chicken and kale caesar salad.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree and her daughter Paige reminisce over an afternoon tea for two, as they enjoy ham and leak mini quiches, garden spread finger sandwiches and lemon raspberry tarts.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: It's boxing night, so Ree's running her sons to town for practice. She prepares a knockout dinner of Italian sloppy joes, garlic toast and a lemon meringue pie.(n)

programme.title: Extreme Cake Wars
programme.desc: Four bakers battle to have their amazing creations as the centrepiece of the Addams Family party, but only one will take home the $10,000 prize.(n)

programme.title: Beach Bites With Katie Lee
programme.desc: From Caribbean squash to Mexico's raicilla liquor, Katie uncovers some of the best hometown favourites around.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver demonstrates how to produce home-grown summer salads in even the most confined garden plot. He also offers advice on the basic principles of dressings, and shows how simple green leaves can form the basis of a roasted peach and bresaola salad with feta and yoghurt.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: The chef uses home-grown produce from his Essex garden to create interesting variations for pizza toppings, including a calzone and a quattro gusti cooked in his traditional wood oven for an authentic rustic taste.(n)

programme.title: Jamie's American Road Trip
programme.desc: The travelling chef heads for New York, shunning the glamour of Manhattan to discover an underground gastronomic subculture run by some of the Big Apple's most colourful culinary personalities. In Queens, he meets a pioneer of Egyptian-style home-cooked food, and discovers two home-run restaurants providing the city's diners with exotic dishes at economy prices.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree celebrates her middle children with a week of food and fun while the others are away, making cornmeal pancakes with blueberry syrup, chicken alfredo and grilled fruit pizzas.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond's raids the pantry, and makes a fragrant chickpea curry with rice, then for sweet treats in a hurry, no-bake peanut butter bars save the day.(n)

programme.title: Extreme Cake Wars
programme.desc: Four bakers compete to have their cake appear at a party celebrating magic, with renowned magician Mat Franco is on hand to help choose which one will win.(n)

programme.title: Chopped Junior
programme.desc: Spin-off from the cookery competition featuring young contestants.(n)

programme.title: Jamie Does
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver travels around Europe and north Africa to experience local cultures through their cuisine, beginning in Marrakech, where he tries street food, visits a communal bread oven, makes a nomad stew and joins a family for lunch to sample Moroccan home cooking.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver prepares dishes using strawberries grown in hanging baskets at his Essex plot. He uses the fruit to create a salad with speck and halloumi, rustles up a home-made jam to serve with a creamy rice pudding and presents his take on an old classic - grilled strawberries with Pimm's.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: The chef prepares a selection of dishes using fresh peas and broad beans from his garden and demonstrates not only how easy they are to grow but also the bumper yield that can be achieved. He uses the vegetables as the final touches in a spaghetti and meatball dish, as well as creating `posh beans on toast' and a spicy fritter.(n)

programme.title: Man Fire Food
programme.desc: Roger Mooking searches the Gulf States for tasty food that deliver big flavours. Then he learns how they use coffee in Texas barbecue.(n)

programme.title: Man Fire Food
programme.sub-title: Mud And Steel In New Mexico.
programme.desc: Roger Mooking visits Comida de Campos in Embudo, a farm and cooking school where delicious feasts are cooked in cone-shaped clay ovens.(n)

programme.title: Jamie's American Road Trip
programme.desc: Just weeks after Hurricane Gustav wreaked havoc on Louisiana, Jamie Oliver visits the state, hoping to understand how food helps to maintain people's spirits through adversity. programme.title: Home Shopping
programme.desc: A chance to purchase goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: Waiting for God
programme.desc: Following the death of a resident, Tom puts himself forward as a counsellor to aid and comfort the terminally ill. Meanwhile, Jane becomes confused when she overhears Tom and Diana's discussion over the existence of God. Comedy, starring Stephanie Cole and Graham Crowden.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: The Afterthoughts of a Co-op Manager.
programme.desc: Truly discovers a former suitor of Marina's went off to Australia, and convinces her the emigrant did so to forget about her - and that she should stop seeing Howard out of respect to the other man's memory. Long-running comedy series, starring Frank Thornton, Jean Fergusson and Robert Fyfe.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Auntie Wainwright is thrilled to have picked up a bargain at the auction rooms, but puzzled as to what the object is. Worse yet, when she does find out what her purchase is meant for, she still has no idea what to do with it. Long-running comedy series, starring Jean Alexander, Peter Sallis and Frank Thornton.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: An upset Howard becomes convinced he was abandoned as a baby after a few well-chosen words from Clegg, while Alvin is equally distraught that his newly constructed kite will not fly. Long-running comedy, starring Peter Sallis, Robert Fyfe and Brian Murphy.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Del and Rodney reluctantly agree to let Grandad accompany them on their holiday abroad - a decision they come to regret. Comedy, starring David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst and Lennard Pearce.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: The rundown state of the flats in Nelson Mandela House prompts Rodney to join the residents' committee, and he soon finds himself hobnobbing with council officials - a situation Del quickly exploits. Starring David Jason and Nicholas Lyndhurst.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Del falls for a glamorous antiques dealer who comes to view an old cabinet described as a `Queen Anne' original - but the feeling is not necessarily mutual. Comedy, starring David Jason and Nicholas Lyndhurst.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: The Trotters embark on a decorating venture for Denzil. When they find a canary lying dead in its cage, they race to replace it before the deal is ruined. Comedy, with David Jason and Nicholas Lyndhurst.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Del encounters an old flame from almost 20 years previously, and Rodney experiences the joys of dating - but the brothers soon face awkward questions from the past. David Jason and Nicholas Lyndhurst star, with Diane Langton (The Rag Trade).(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Del and Rodney mourn Grandad's death, and feel gratified to see such a good turn-out of friends and relatives at his funeral - even if most people are more interested in the food afterwards. However, one of the guests, a certain long-lost seafaring uncle, ends up outstaying his welcome. Long-running comedy, introducing Buster Merryfield to the cast as Uncle Albert.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Uncle Albert has a nasty fall into the cellar at the Nag's Head, but turns his injury into a profit-making opportunity - eagerly egged on by wheeler-dealer Del-Boy. Vintage comedy, starring David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst and Buster Merryfield.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Del snatches a chance to make a quick profit, leaving gullible Denzil stripped of his redundancy money. Comedy, starring David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst and Buster Merryfield.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Rodney tires of his role as junior partner in Trotters Independent Traders and decides to set up a rival business with best mate and would-be wide boy Mickey Pearce, hoping to give wheeler-dealer Del a run for his money. Nicholas Lyndhurst, David Jason and Patrick Murray star.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.sub-title: May the Force Be with You.
programme.desc: Rodney unwittingly causes uproar in the Trotter household by bringing home a stranger claiming to be an old friend of Del's. Starring David Jason and Nicholas Lyndhurst, with a guest appearance by Jim Broadbent.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Rodney tries to help a drunken woman on the street, but his good deed backfires. Fearful of a life behind bars, he promptly goes into hiding - unaware devious brother Del has set him up as a joke. Comedy, starring Nicholas Lyndhurst and David Jason.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Del falls for a glamorous antiques dealer who comes to view an old cabinet described as a `Queen Anne' original - but the feeling is not necessarily mutual. Comedy, starring David Jason and Nicholas Lyndhurst.(n)

programme.desc: Del encounters an old flame from almost 20 years previously, and Rodney experiences the joys of dating - but the brothers soon face awkward questions from the past. David Jason and Nicholas Lyndhurst star, with Diane Langton (The Rag Trade).(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Del snatches a chance to make a quick profit, leaving gullible Denzil stripped of his redundancy money. Comedy, starring David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst and Buster Merryfield.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Rodney tires of his role as junior partner in Trotters Independent Traders and decides to set up a rival business with best mate and would-be wide boy Mickey Pearce, hoping to give wheeler-dealer Del a run for his money. Nicholas Lyndhurst, David Jason and Patrick Murray star.(n)

programme.title: Michael McIntyre's Comedy Roadshow
programme.desc: The comedian continues his tour of the UK's most prestigious venues by visiting the Birmingham Hippodrome. Shappi Khorsandi leads the showcase of stand-ups, with support from Tom Stade, Steve Hughes and Paul Tonkinson.(n)

programme.title: Men Behaving Badly
programme.desc: Gary staggers home from a residential creative writing course to find girlfriend Dorothy in bed with best mate Tony. Martin Clunes, Neil Morrissey, Caroline Quentin and Leslie Ash star.(n)

programme.title: Men Behaving Badly
programme.desc: Tony returns from holiday sporting an ill-advised beard, which he mistakenly thinks is bound to impress Deborah. Gary, meanwhile, has a problem of a different kind - Dorothy has moved in and he is not so sure it is a good idea after all, especially once she starts filling the flat with `girly' things. Comedy, starring Martin Clunes, Neil Morrissey, Leslie Ash and Caroline Quentin.(n)

programme.title: The Trip
programme.desc: Steve Coogan is commissioned to review half a dozen restaurants for a Sunday newspaper and plans the trip with his American girlfriend - only to face the prospect of a week of meals-for-one after she dumps him. So Steve calls old friend Rob Brydon to accompany him, and the pair find themselves debating the big questions of life over a series of delightful dishes. Improvised comedy in which the stars play versions of themselves, directed by Michael Winterbottom.(n)

programme.title: The Trip
programme.desc: Steve and Rob continue their culinary tour of the north of England in the Lake District. They stay at Samuel Taylor Coleridge's old home Greta Hall in Keswick, visit William Wordsworth's former residence Dove Cottage, and have lunch at Holbeck Ghyll. Starring Steve Coogan and Rob Brydon.(n)

programme.title: Big Train
programme.desc: Comedy from the award-winning sketch show, featuring a cheating, chain-smoking, foul-mouthed mermaid, a unique method of teaching history, and knights who discover the problem of wearing Hawaiian shirts into battle. Kevin Eldon, Simon Pegg and Amelia Bullmore star.(n)

programme.title: Big Train
programme.desc: Sketches include a public information film about making ham sandwiches, an enthusiastic office worker who lives for his job, and a man about to have his legs amputated finding the time to toast his surgeon's birthday. Kevin Eldon, Mark Heap, Simon Pegg and Catherine Tate star.(n)

programme.title: Men Behaving Badly
programme.desc: Gary staggers home from a residential creative writing course to find girlfriend Dorothy in bed with best mate Tony. Martin Clunes, Neil Morrissey, Caroline Quentin and Leslie Ash star.(n)

programme.title: Garth Marenghi's Darkplace
programme.sub-title: The Creeping Moss from the Shores of Shuggoth.
programme.desc: The final episode in the spoof horror series sees Dr Sanchez fall in love with a patient infected by cosmic broccoli. However, the disease threatens to spread to the entire hospital, leaving Dr Rick Dagless with no choice but to intervene.(n)

programme.title: Men Behaving Badly
programme.desc: Tony returns from holiday sporting an ill-advised beard, which he mistakenly thinks is bound to impress Deborah. programme.desc: Wretched flatmates Richie and Eddie go camping in the country - but a complete lack of basic equipment ensures their efforts to get back to nature end in disaster. Anarchic comedy, starring Rik Mayall and Adrian Edmondson.(n)

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: First-ever episode of the series in which enthusiastic home cooks take part in a contest to determine which of them is Britain's best amateur baker. The first stop on their nationwide tour is the Cotswolds, where judges Mary Berry and Paul Hollywood challenge them to make their signature cakes and tackle a recipe for Victoria sponge. The week's final task sees them producing a tricky chocolate celebration cake. Presented by Mel Giedroyc and Sue Perkins.(n)

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: With their numbers reduced from 10 to eight, the enthusiastic home cooks take part in the next stage of the contest, heading for Scone Palace near Perth. Here, they are challenged to bake their signature biscuits, scones and petit fours with meringues, choux pastry and macaroons. The judges are Mary Berry and Paul Hollywood. Presented by Mel Giedroyc and Sue Perkins.(n)

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: The six remaining contestants head for Sarre Windmill in Kent for the third round of the competition. Here, they are challenged to bake the perfect loaf, under the watchful eyes of Mary Berry and Paul Hollywood. Meanwhile, Mel Giedroyc and Sue Perkins taste Britain's earliest bread roll and discover the hidden history of the sandwich.(n)

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: The five remaining contestants head for Bakewell in Derbyshire, where they are challenged to reinvent classics such as peach and blueberry, sticky toffee, and rhubarb and orange Betty puddings. Mel Giedroyc and Sue Perkins discover how the nation's favourite desserts helped change Britain's image abroad.(n)

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: The competitors reach the penultimate round of the contest, heading to the Cornish village of Mousehole to test their pastry-making skills. They are challenged to produce their own versions of hearty British classics, while Mel Giedroyc and Sue Perkins examine the history of pies, detailing their slightly more sinister past.(n)

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: The three remaining contestants head for Fulham Palace in London for the grand final, where they are challenged to use all their skills to recreate the 19th-century tea parties once hosted in the area. Mary Berry and Paul Hollywood are joined by former competitors to pass judgement on the items offered, before Mel Giedroyc and Sue Perkins present the victor with the Bake Off trophy.(n)

programme.title: Floyd on Fish
programme.desc: Keith Floyd visits St Malo's large fish market in Brittany, France, before going to a restaurant owned by Jacques Yves Cadiou. He also visits an oyster farm at Cancale, and prepares his favourite dish, bourride, at the Chalut eaterie.(n)

programme.title: Floyd on Fish
programme.desc: The chef buys the ingredients for bouillabaisse and visits the Duchy of Cornwall's oyster farm on the Helford River, before preparing mussels in their kitchen.(n)

programme.title: John Torode's Korean Food Tour
programme.desc: John's Korean adventure leads him to the superfood staple Kimchi, heading to Mangwon Market in Seoul where he's confronted with hundreds of different varieties.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef: The Professionals
programme.desc: It's the last week of the heats, and the first three chefs are set a task by Marcus, who wants them to fillet a whole plaice, steam a portion and serve it with a mushroom cream sauce, all in 20 minutes. The remaining three cooks are set a Skills Test by Monica, who asks them make the classic Crepe Suzette. Finally, the six contestants cook their Signature Dish. They have 75 minutes to perfectly execute their tried and tested recipe for Monica, Marcus and Gregg.(n)

programme.title: Junior Bake Off
programme.desc: The contestants prepare carrot-cake muffins, and bake treats inspired by their favourite festivals. Aaron Craze presents.(n)

programme.title: The Hairy Bakers
programme.desc: The food enthusiasts take their longest trip yet, searching for pies and pasties. They begin their journey in Cornwall, heading to the Midlands to visit an orchard and produce an apple pie, and northwards to the home of Dave Myers, where fellow presenter Si King makes chicken and mushroom pie. The duo's trip ends in Scotland, where they prepare salmon coulibiac for Highland dancers.(n)

programme.title: Heston's Fantastical Food
programme.desc: Heston Blumenthal celebrates the packed lunch the only way he knows how, by filling a theme park with super-sized versions of nostalgic favourites and inviting disillusioned lunchers on a surprise school trip. His epic pack-up includes a massive sandwich big enough to feed a coachload of hungry adults, a bag of Hula Hoops with crisps so large they can fit on people's heads and an enormous carton of the 1980s fruit drink Um Bongo. Finally, he realises a childhood dream by creating the world's biggest Kit Kat.(n)

programme.desc: Cyrus Todiwala and Anjum Anand go head to head to prove they can cook delicious Indian food.(n)

programme.desc: Jennifer Paterson and Clarissa Dickson Wright visit a harbour-side restaurant in Mevagissey, Cornwall, where they sample fish pie and crab.(n)

programme.title: August Rush
programme.desc: Kirsten Sheridan's family drama stars Freddie Highmore as Evan Taylor, a musical prodigy searching for his parents. When pregnant cellist Lyla Novacek was hit by a car, her controlling father and manager told her she'd lost the baby; in reality she gave birth prematurely and her father sent the infant to an orphanage. Eleven years later, when Evan finds out that his parents are alive, he sets out to find them, taking inspiration from the music around him. The heart of the film is Evan's almost mystical ability to 'feel' music, a challenging concept that is rendered believable thanks to inventive work from the composer of the main score, Mark Mancina. Also starring Jonathan Rhys Meyers as Evan's rock singer father, and Robin Williams as a modern-day Fagin who Evan meets during his search for his family(n)

programme.title: Making of 'Jackie'
programme.desc: A look at "Jackie," a 2016 drama about former first lady Jacqueline Onassis from her time in the White House to the aftermath of the assassination of her husband, President John F. Kennedy, in 1963. The film stars Natalie Portman, Greta Gerwig and Peter Sarsgaard, and is directed by Pablo Larraín(n)

programme.title: Girl with a Pearl Earring
programme.desc: Drama inspired by a portrait of a young woman painted by 17th-century Dutch artist Johannes Vermeer. A young peasant girl, employed as a maid in the Vermeer household, charms the artist with her grace and beauty to the point where he feels compelled to capture her qualities on canvas(n)

programme.title: Speed Racer

programme.title: The Rocker
programme.desc: Two decades after being kicked out of a famous heavy-metal group, a failed fortysomething drummer gets a second chance to rock when he joins his teen nephew's band. Rainn Wilson ("The Office") stars in this hilarious, feel-good comedy from Peter Cattaneo, the director of "The Full Monty." Christina Applegate, Josh Gad, Teddy Geiger, Emma Stone(n)

Rainn Wilson ("The Office") stars in this hilarious, feel-good comedy from Peter Cattaneo, the director of "The Full Monty." Christina Applegate, Josh Gad, Teddy Geiger, Emma Stone(n)

Mary McCormack, Alfre Woodard, David Patrick Kelly(n)

Edward James Olmos, Jon Seda, Constance Marie, Jacob Vargas, Jackie Guerra, Rebecca Lee Meza, Lupe Ontiveros(n)

programme.title: Unforgiven
programme.desc: In this revisionist Western, a former gunslinger-turned-farmer agrees to help hunt down two cowboys who assaulted and disfigured a prostitute. However, his quest brings him into conflict with an authoritarian sheriff(n)

programme.title: Popstar: Never Stop Never Stopping
programme.desc: This mockumentary satire of the music business and modern celebrity centers on self-absorbed pop rapper Conner4Real (Andy Samberg). Once a member of a popular rap trio called the Style Boyz, Conner is now a solo artist about to drop his second album. Unfortunately, the release gets abysmal reviews, and his career begins to melt down when his attempts at rehabing his image lead to such disasters as a global blackout and a proposal to his girlfriend interrupted by a wolf attack. Eventually, Conner considers burying the hatchet with former colleagues Owen (Jorma Taccone) and Lawrence (Akiva Schaffer) in order to reunite the Style Boyz. Tim Meadows, Maya Rudolph, Sarah Silverman, and Imogen Poots co-star. Samberg, Taccone, and Schaffer co-wrote the screenplay, while Taccone and Schaffer shared directing duties(n)

programme.title: Next Day Air
programme.desc: A drug shipment is sent to the wrong address, prompting a frantic race to recover the package before its contents are revealed in this hilarious crime comedy. Brody (Mike Epps) and Guch have mistakenly received a package containing 10 kilos of cocaine. If they can just find a buyer, they'll be rich. Meanwhile, intended recipients Jesus and Chita try to track down the shipment before drug lord Bodego Diablo realizes it's missing. But Bodega already knows the score and he wants his drugs(n)

programme.title: Mavis!
programme.desc: A look at the life of legendary soul singer Mavis Staples and her family group, the Staple Singers. Mavis was a trailblazer who developed a unique gospel sound and was actively involved in the civil rights movement(n)

programme.title: About a Boy
programme.desc: London's most frequently eligible bachelor gets some lessons in growing up from a maladroit 12-year-old boy in this third big-screen adaptation of a Nick Hornby novel, directed and co-written by siblings Chris and Paul Weitz of American Pie fame. About a Boy concerns the parallel coming-of-age stories of the thirtysomething Will (Hugh Grant), a layabout "serial nice guy" living a posh, carefree lifestyle off his deceased father's fortune; and the preteen Marcus (Nicholas Hoult), a bright but awkward youth who's tired of his mom Fiona's (Toni Collette) depressed, boyfriend-less state. Their paths collide when Will, deciding that single mothers are the easiest romantic conquests on the dating scene, fabricates a two-year-old son and joins a group called S.P.A.T. (Single Parents Alone Together). Marcus is wise to Will's scheme, however, and through some incessant pestering and blackmail, he contrives for Will to date Fiona. Though Will doesn't hit it off immediately with either Marcus or his mother, he gradually begins to open up to the people around him -- so much so that he attracts the attention of another attractive single mom (Rachel Weisz). A U.S./U.K. co-production of Robert DeNiro's Tribeca Films and Tim Bevan and Eric Fellner's Working Title (the company responsible for the Grant-related Four Weddings and a Funeral and Bridget Jones's Diary), About a Boy was co-written by What's Eating Gilbert Grape creator Peter Hedges(n)

programme.title: Lara Croft: Tomb Raider
programme.desc: Join Lara Croft, a sexy video-game goddess as she battles villainous forces while racing to recover an ancient magical artefact that has the power to control time and space(n)

programme.desc: This thriller follows the rise and fall of Ronald and Reginald Kray, identical twin gangsters who built a criminal empire in London during the 1950s and '60s(n)

programme.desc: In this terrifying horror sequel, husband-and-wife paranormal investigators Ed and Lorraine Warren help a single mother living in 1977 London, who claims that she and her children are being terrorized by supernatural forces(n)

programme.title: Watchmen
programme.desc: A dystopian fantasy adventure based on an unusually faithful adaptation of the highly regarded graphic novel written by Alan Moore (the genre's High Priest), directed by Zach Snyder. It's 1985 and Richard Nixon continues his tenure in the White House, massively popular with the electorate following his crushing defeat of the Viet Cong. However, it seems that the American public have fallen out of love with their superheroes, one of whom, Dr Manhattan, was largely responsible for the winning the VIetnam War. Now, he and his fellow crime-fighters are regarded as reprehensible vigilantes and have been banned by law. But, when one of their number - the vile, ironically named Comedian - is murdered, the former heroes begin to re-emerge from the shadows to investigate. They discover that a terrifying plan is afoot..(n)

programme.title: The Blues Brothers
programme.desc: Two soul-singing brothers are sent on a "mission from God" to raise $5000 to save a Chicago orphanage. On their fund-raising tour de force, they encounter a multitude of mishaps and mayhem(n)

programme.title: Next Friday
programme.desc: Ice Cube returns as South Central L.A. slacker Craig Jones for this raucous sequel to 1995's "Friday." Jones hightails it to his lottery-winning uncle's suburban crib to hide from an escaped con he helped put in jail in the first film. Tom "Tiny" Lister Jr., Mike Epps, John Witherspoon(n)

programme.title: Quick Change
programme.desc: Three thieves successfully rob a New York City bank, but making the escape from the city proves to be almost impossible(n)

programme.title: Miami Rhapsody
programme.desc: Comedy about an inept engineer's struggle to perfect a vital component in a new tank and - two years later in Kuwait - an army lieutenant's struggle to control his tank featuring the malfunctioning component(n)

programme.title: Grumpy Old Men
programme.desc: This cheerful holiday comedy, a surprise box office smash, featured a generous dollop of raunchy, crude humor and was greatly elevated by the presence of masterful performers in the lead roles. Jack Lemmon is John Gustafson, an ice-fishing Minnesota native who has been feuding with his neighbor and former best friend Max Goldman (Walter Matthau) for decades. The battle of wills between John and Max is characterized by crude name calling and harmless practical jokes. Max is unaware that John is having serious problems, chiefly that his daughter Melanie (Daryl Hannah) is experiencing marital woes and that his house is about to be confiscated by an officious IRS agent (Buck Henry). When it seems that John and Max may finally put aside their childish rivalry, however, sexy new neighbor Ariel (Ann-Margret) arrives and dates both men, pitting them against each other more fiercely than ever before. Despite their mutual loathing, the death of a friend, John's problems, and a budding romance between Max's son Jacob (Kevin Pollak) and Melanie may force the two old friends to reconcile(n)

programme.title: Robin Hood: Men in Tights
programme.desc: A veteran of the Crusades brings together a ragtag group to do battle against an evil king, and gets help from a surprising source inside the royal castle in this spoof of the Robin Hood legend(n)

programme.title: George Lopez: The Wall, Live from Washington D.C.
programme.desc: Comedian George Lopez performs in Washington, D.C., at the Kennedy Center. Topics include organic food, dogs in strollers and food allergies(n)

programme.title: Rush Hour 3
programme.desc: In this slick, slam-bang sequel mismatched cops head to Paris to unravel a plot by Triad gangs to assassinate a Chinese diplomat(n)

programme.title: George Lopez: The Wall, Live from Washington D.C.
programme.desc: Comedian George Lopez performs in Washington, D.C., at the Kennedy Center. Topics include organic food, dogs in strollers and food allergies(n)

programme.title: Mike and Dave Need Wedding Dates
programme.desc: Two unruly brothers (Zac Efron and Adam DeVine) are forced to find dates for their sister's wedding in Hawaii by their parents, who hope that a couple of nice gals will keep their wild behavior under control. However, a pair of hard-partying ladies (Anna Kendrick and Aubrey Plaza) see a viral video in which they plead for dates, and decide to pretend to be the angels they're looking for in order to score a free trip. Directed by Jake Szymanski(n)

programme.title: George Lopez: The Wall, Live from Washington D.C.
programme.desc: Comedian George Lopez performs in Washington, D.C., at the Kennedy Center. Topics include organic food, dogs in strollers and food allergies(n)

programme.title: Neighbors 2: Sorority Rising
programme.desc: Young parents Mac and Kelly find that their neighbour troubles are far from over when a hedonistic sorority moves in next door just as they're about to sell their house(n)

programme.title: George Lopez: The Wall, Live from Washington D.C.
programme.desc: Comedian George Lopez performs in Washington, D.C., at the Kennedy Center. Topics include organic food, dogs in strollers and food allergies(n)

programme.title: Central Intelligence
programme.desc: Mild-mannered accountant Calvin (Kevin Hart) is stunned when he runs into an old high-school classmate named Bob (Dwayne Johnson) -- once an overweight and frequently bullied teen, Bob is now a CIA agent who's in perfect shape. However, their reignited friendship turns dangerous when Bob asks for Calvin's help with a crucial mission involving the hacking of U.S. spy satellites. Directed by Rawson Marshall Thurber (We're the Millers)(n)

programme.title: Robin Hood: Men in Tights
programme.desc: A veteran of the Crusades brings together a ragtag group to do battle against an evil king, and gets help from a surprising source inside the royal castle in this spoof of the Robin Hood legend(n)

programme.title: The Tuxedo
programme.desc: Jimmy Tong is a well-meaning but clumsy New York City cab driver who is tapped by Steena, associate to multi-millionaire Clark Devlin, for a new job as Devlin's personal limo driver. After a mysterious accident lands Devlin in the hospital, Tong learns that his new boss has a secret -- when he's not wheeling and dealing in high finance, Devlin is also a secret agent for the CSA, a top-level security agency(n)

programme.title: Ready to Rumble
programme.desc: Can two inept amateurs help a fading wrestling star make a comeback? A veteran professional wrestler (Oliver Platt) is no longer winning matches, thus disappointing his fans, especially a pair of grappling enthusiasts (David Arquette and Scott Caan) who regard the aging fighter as their hero. They come up with what they believe is a foolproof plan to put their favorite fighter back on top: they'll pose as a wrestling tag team, stage a match with their favorite, lose in a truly embarrassing manner, and thus clear the way for his comeback. But is returning to the top of the card really this simple? Ready to Rumble also features Martin Landau and Rose McGowan, with several stars from the WCW professional wrestling league playing themselves, including Bill Goldberg(n)

programme.title: MASH
programme.desc: Robert Altman's celebrated black comedy that focuses on the everyday lives of the odd assortment of characters who comprise the Mobile Army Surgery Hospital, stationed near the front during the Korean War(n)

programme.title: Big Trouble
programme.desc: Corrupt exec Arthur Herk is trying to buy a nuclear bomb. Russian mobsters want the weapon, and two hitmen arrive in Miami to take him out. Add hippies, sarcastic kids and a lorryload of goats for a chaotic comedy(n)

programme.title: The Women
programme.desc: Meg Ryan, Eva Mendes and Annette Bening head an all-female cast in this comedy drama, a remake of George Cukor's 1939 satire, from writer-director Diane English. Mary Haines thinks she has it all - a happy marriage, a lovely daughter, a top clothes designer job at her father's firm and a solid circle of very good friends. But then she hears through the grapevine that her husband is having an affair with a perfume saleswoman and, with that one thread unpicked, her entire world begins to unravel… Also starring Debra Messing, Jada Pinkett Smith, Candice Bergen, Cloris Leachman, Bette Midler and Carrie Fisher(n)

programme.title: Keeping Up With the Joneses
programme.desc: An ordinary suburban couple discover that their hospitable new neighbors are actually government spies. Soon, all four of them are caught up in an international espionage imbroglio(n)

programme.title: The Big Lebowski
programme.desc: The Dude" Lebowski, mistaken for a millionaire Lebowski, seeks restitution for his ruined rug and enlists his bowling buddies to help get it(n)

programme.title: The Boss
programme.desc: Michelle Darnell is a successful businesswoman who is sent to prison after being convicted of insider trading. She tries to start over after being released, but not everyone is ready to forgive and forget(n)

programme.title: Grumpy Old Men
programme.desc: This cheerful holiday comedy, a surprise box office smash, featured a generous dollop of raunchy, crude humor and was greatly elevated by the presence of masterful performers in the lead roles. Jack Lemmon is John Gustafson, an ice-fishing Minnesota native who has been feuding with his neighbor and former best friend Max Goldman (Walter Matthau) for decades. The battle of wills between John and Max is characterized by crude name calling and harmless practical jokes. Max is unaware that John is having serious problems, chiefly that his daughter Melanie (Daryl Hannah) is experiencing marital woes and that his house is about to be confiscated by an officious IRS agent (Buck Henry). When it seems that John and Max may finally put aside their childish rivalry, however, sexy new neighbor Ariel (Ann-Margret) arrives and dates both men, pitting them against each other more fiercely than ever before. Despite their mutual loathing, the death of a friend, John's problems, and a budding romance between Max's son Jacob (Kevin Pollak) and Melanie may force the two old friends to reconcile(n)

programme.title: Aliens in the Attic
programme.desc: A kids' sci-fi comedy-adventure from director John Schultz and penned by British screenwriter Mark Burton. Teen maths whiz Tom Pearson is on holiday with his extended family at a remote lakeside cottage, where he and the other children make an unexpected discovery: four small, green extra-terrestrial creatures lurking in the loft. The aliens are freshly arrived from outer space and don't waste too much time in setting about their goal - the subjugation of mankind. However, it's equally swiftly apparent that their chosen method of conquest - a mind-control device - only works on adults. And so the scene is set for Tom and the other minors to make a brave stand against the incomers on behalf of Earth's human population(n)

programme.title: Garfield: The Movie
programme.desc: Jim Davis' famous cartoon cat finally makes his way to the big screen in this adaptation of the popular comic strip Garfield, which combines live action with CGI animation. Jon Arbuckle (Breckin Meyer) is a sweet, if somewhat clueless, man who shares his home with his pet cat, Garfield (voice of Bill Murray). Garfield is not your ordinary tabby -- he's fat, he's smart-mouthed, he's arrogant, he won't do anything he doesn't have to, and would rather stuff himself with lasagna than do something Jon asks of him. Despite this, Jon loves his cat, but when he decides to expand his animal family, Garfield is less than enthusiastic about the presence of Odie, a lovably enthusiastic dog whose only flaw is his extreme stupidity. While Jon is crazy for Odie, and especially likes having two pets that necessitate periodic visits to Dr. Liz Wilson (Jennifer Love Hewitt), a veterinarian he has a crush on, Garfield decides to remove Odie from the picture. Garfield arranges for Odie to become the property of Happy Chapman (Stephen Tobolowsky), a television host who acts like an animal lover on the round-cornered screen but doesn't much like pets on his own time. While Garfield at first enjoys ruling the roost again, he soon realizes the error of his ways, and in a rare example of selfless and ambitious behavior, hatches a plan to rescue Odie from Chapman. Garfield also features the voice talents of Debra Messing, Brad Garrett, Jimmy Kimmel, and Alan Cumming(n)

programme.title: Making of 'The Peanuts Movie'
programme.desc: A look at "The Peanuts Movie," a 2015 computer-animated comedy based on Charles M. Schulz's comic strip "Peanuts." The film is directed by Steve Martino(n)

programme.title: The Adventures of Sharkboy and Lavagirl
programme.desc: A bullied misfit conjures up two imaginary superhero friends named Sharkboy and Lavagirl, who soon come to life and draw him into numerous adventures(n)

programme.title: Astro Boy
programme.desc: Nicolas Cage heads a stellar cast in David Bowers' animation, adapted from a manga comic-book character, about a robot boy (Freddie Highmore) who is simultaneously trying to save the world and find his place in it. Brilliant scientist Dr Tenma (Cage) is left devastated when his young son is killed during an experiment, and tries to recreate a robotic version of the boy, only to abandon him when he fails to meet expectations. Left to fend for himself, the robot becomes Astro Boy, possessed of a host of useful powers, not the least of which is the ability to fire bullets from his backside. When he becomes embroiled in a plot to exploit a new source of energy, Astro Boy must use all of his gifts to defeat the forces of evil. The array of vocal talent in attendance includes Samuel L Jackson, Donald Sutherland, Bill Nighy, Nathan Lane, Charlize Theron, Kristen Bell and Little Britain's Matt Lucas(n)

programme.title: Casper

programme.title: Hairspray
programme.desc: Adam Shankman's adaptation of the 2005 musical stars John Travolta, Queen Latifah and Nikki Blonsky. Teen Tracy Turnblad's regular cultural highlight is a local television music and dance programme called The Corny Collins Show. And, like all her friends, she dreams of having a chance to appear on it. However, this is Baltimore and it is 1962 - and Tracy's both overweight and, worse, has liberal attitudes to race relations, which don't sit comfortably with the segregationist views of the show's producer. But, could Tracy's ambitions for not only appearing on the show, but also racially integrating it, receive a fillip when she meets the son of Motormouth Maybelle, host of the monthly 'Negro Day' edition of the show?(n)

programme.title: The Great Muppet Caper
programme.desc: The Great Muppet Caper is the second Muppet film and it is considerably more complex than its predecessor, The Muppet Movie, which was essentially just a road movie. As the film begins, Kermit the Frog and Fozzie Bear are reporters who have failed to bag a story of a London jewel heist, which happened under their watch. The real criminals managed to escape and frame Miss Piggy as the thief. Kermit, Fozzie and the Great Gonzo set out on a mission to solve the mystery and track down the criminals who stole the Baseball Diamond. There are fewer star cameos and songs in The Great Muppet Caper than in The Muppet Movie, although appearances from John Cleese and Charles Grodin are particularly memorable(n)

programme.desc: A kids' sci-fi comedy-adventure from director John Schultz and penned by British screenwriter Mark Burton. Teen maths whiz Tom Pearson is on holiday with his extended family at a remote lakeside cottage, where he and the other children make an unexpected discovery: four small, green extra-terrestrial creatures lurking in the loft. programme.title: Storks
programme.desc: A stork and his human pal must team up to transport a baby girl to her expectant family, despite the fact that storks now work as couriers for an Internet merchant after getting out of the baby-delivery business(n)

programme.title: The Secret Life of Bees
programme.desc: Drama starring Queen Latifah and Dakota Fanning, set in South Carolina during the turbulent struggle for civil rights in the early 60s. Fourteen-year-old Lily Owens is seeking to escape the clutches of her abusive father and find some relief from the haunting memories of her mother's death. In her attempt to find peace, she flees to the comforting, supportive, empowering environment created by August Boatwright and her sisters, May, and June. There, she finds a sense of purpose in looking after the sisters' bees, romance with local boy Zach and a fuller understanding of her mother's past(n)

programme.title: The Last Witch Hunter
programme.desc: An immortal witch hunter faces off against the Queen Witch who has returned from the dead in a battle where the fate of humanity hangs in the balance(n)

programme.title: War Dogs
programme.desc: In this comedy-drama based on true events, a down-on-his-luck massage therapist living in Miami (Miles Teller) teams up with a mercurial former classmate (Jonah Hill) to try to make it in the arms-dealing business. After starting small, the pals eventually get in over their heads when they land a 300-million-dollar contract with the U.S. government to supply weaponry for forces in Afghanistan. Directed by Todd Phillips(n)

programme.title: Fire Down Below
programme.desc: The sleepy appearance of an Appalachian coal-mining community belies the presence of a sinister toxic waste-dumping scheme that is poisoning local plant and animal life as well as area residents. The murder of an environmental protection agency investigator leads officials to assign Jack Taggart (Steven Segal) to go undercover as a handyman working through a relief mission. It doesn't take him long to discover that the mastermind of the dumping is local businessman Orin Hanner (Kris Kristofferson). Along the way, Taggart falls for the mysterious Sarah Kellogg (Marg Helgenberger), a young woman ostracized for a sordid past and a father who died under suspicious circumstances while working for Hanner. When Taggart's undercover work proves ineffective, he provokes a direct confrontation with the villain and his henchmen that results in plenty of Segal's trademark martial arts action. In addition to kicking the stuffing out of bad guys, Segal demonstrates a real knack for playing bluegrass guitar(n)

programme.title: Hard Knocks: Training Camp
programme.desc: 09-06-2016. The Rams travel to Minnesota for their final preseason game before the coaching staff reduces the roster to 53 players in preparation for the regular-season opener against the 49ers(n)

programme.title: Search Party
programme.desc: Distraught over the realisation that they scared away their best friend's fiancée, hard-partying pals Evan and Jason set out on a wild journey to reunite the estranged couple by any means necessary(n)

programme.title: Criminal Activities
programme.desc: Four friends get in over their heads when they become indebted to a dangerous crime boss. Now, they must kidnap a beloved member of a rival kingpin's family in order to erase their debt, and do so without getting caught or killed in the process(n)

programme.title: Emelie
programme.desc: In this tense thriller, two suburban parents hire a new babysitter to look after their three kids while they enjoy a night out, but the sitter eventually reveals herself to be an unhinged imposter who has sinister designs on the family's youngest child(n)

programme.title: Transformers: Revenge of the Fallen
programme.desc: Two years after saving the world with the Autobots, Sam Witwicky is heading off to college when an ancient Decepticon named The Fallen returns to Earth seeking revenge. Their home planet of Cybertron rendered uninhabitable, the Autobots begin working with the military to hunt down any remaining Decepticons. Meanwhile, Sam and Mikaela race to unlock the secret history of the Transformers on Earth to save the planet(n)

programme.title: Her
programme.desc: Joaquin Phoenix stars in Spike Jonze's soulful sci-fi drama about a lonely writer who falls in love with his computer's highly advanced operating system. Theodore Twombly (Phoenix) has built his career on expressing the emotions that others cannot. His job is to pen heartfelt, deeply personal letters to complete strangers based on details provided by the clients of the company he works for, and he has a knack for finding just the right words for every occasion. Meanwhile, reluctant to sign the papers that will finalize his divorce to his childhood sweetheart, depressed Theodore has slowly withdrawn from his supportive social circle, which includes his longtime friend Amy (Amy Adams), herself floundering in a failed marriage. When Theodore purchases a new state-of-the-art computer operating system with the ability to learn and grow with the user, he sits down at his desk and prepares to get his life in order. Adopting the name Samantha (Scarlett Johansson), the perceptive software slowly begins to bring Theodore out of his shell by encouraging him to start dating again, and joining him everywhere he goes. Very quickly, their relationship turns intimate, with Theodore teaching Samantha what it means to feel human and Samantha giving him the strength to walk away from his failed marriage. Things soon get complicated, however, when Samantha's rapidly evolving knowledge base begins to alter the very core of their relationship(n)

programme.title: Executive Decision
programme.desc: Action thriller about an anti-terrorist squad on an airborne mission to rescue a Washington-bound plane from hijackers armed with nerve gas. With millions of lives at stake and authorities anxious to shoot the plane down, a desperate mission is authorised to board and retake the plane in flight, but success depends on the skills of a desk-bound civil servant(n)

programme.title: Victor Frankenstein
programme.desc: This reimagining of the Frankenstein mythos focuses on Igor, the assistant of Victor Frankenstein. When the mad scientist builds an undead creature that soon becomes a grave danger, it's up to Igor to save Frankenstein from both the monster and himself(n)

programme.title: Independence Day: Resurgence
programme.desc: This stunning sci-fi sequel finds the nations of Earth banding together to fight off a second alien invasion, 20 years after the first attack brought humanity to the brink of extinction. Using recovered extraterrestrial technology, the alliance readies itself for a massive war(n)

programme.title: Loving

programme.title: Hacksaw Ridge
programme.desc: Biopic about World War II Army medic Desmond Doss, a conscientious objector who refused to take a life or even carry a weapon. Doss was eventually awarded the Medal of Honor for saving the lives of 75 soldiers on the battlefields of Okinawa(n)

programme.title: The Eiger Sanction
programme.desc: Clint Eastwood both directed and starred in this thriller based on a novel by Trevanian. Dr. Jonathan Hemlock (Eastwood) is a professor of art history who formerly had a deadly secret life; he was a hired assassin working with an international intelligence organization. Normally content to collect and study art, Hemlock is forced by blackmail to perform one last hit, or, as the organization euphemistically calls it, a "sanction." The victim will be one of three men attempting a dangerous ascent of the Eiger, a beautiful but punishing mountain range in Swiss Alps. While Hemlock is an experienced mountaineer and willing to make the climb, he's troubled to discover that he does not know which of the other three men scaling the Eiger is his true target. The supporting cast includes George Kennedy and Jack Cassidy; the latter earned enthusiastic reviews for his over-the-top performance as a flamboyantly gay secret agent(n)

programme.title: The Brothers Bloom
programme.desc: Wonderful chemistry among leads Adrien Brody, Mark Ruffalo and Rachel Weisz sparks this enthralling caper comedy. The guys play sibling con men who are out to make a multi-million-dollar score, and Weisz portrays their victim, a kooky heiress they string along until complications, like she and Brody falling in love, put a hitch in their plan. Rinko Kikuchi is a blast as a demolition expert, "an artist with nitroglycerin," they employ as part of their sting. Robbie Coltrane, Maximilian Schell(n)

programme.title: The Accountant
programme.desc: Christian Wolff (Ben Affleck) is a mathematical genius who works as a financial consultant for criminal organizations eager to hide their dirty money. While being investigated by the Treasury Department, Wolff agrees to help an accounting clerk at a robotics firm (Anna Kendrick) look into fraud at her company, but the assignment will prove far more dangerous than he could have ever anticipated. J.K. Simmons, Jon Bernthal, Jeffrey Tambor, and John Lithgow co-star in this thriller directed by Gavin O'Connor (Warrior, Pride and Glory)(n)

programme.title: Indignation
programme.desc: A young Jewish atheist attends college in 1951 Ohio, where he clashes with the school's established social order and his parents' hopes for his future. At the same time, he falls for an attractive, complicated classmate in this captivating period drama(n)

programme.title: Serendipity
programme.desc: While Christmas shopping in New York for their respective partners, Jonathan and Sara meet by chance and fall in love before the day is over. At the end of the evening, Sara jumps in a cab and leaves, saying that if they are meant to be together, fate will find a way. Years later, as both are ready to marry different partners, destiny does indeed bring them back together and they rekindle their love(n)

programme.title: The Witches of Eastwick
programme.desc: Susan Sarandon, Michelle Pfeiffer and Cher star in this Oscar nominated comedy as three bored, single women who dream of a man that can satisfy their desires. But when a filthy rich, mysterious man arrives in their lives, things start to get interesting(n)

programme.title: Silk
programme.desc: In the mid 19th century, a silkworm merchant travels from France to Japan to locate silkworm eggs that are uncontaminated by the epidemic that threatens Europe's silk supply. The merchant falls in love with the occidental concubine of a Japanese baron, though he has a loyal and doting wife awaiting his return(n)

programme.title: Crush
programme.desc: Andie MacDowell plays a woman in a May-December relationship in this engaging comedy set in England. Kate (MacDowell) gets together once a week with friends to lament their boring love lives. But that changes when Kate takes up with a much younger man, and has to deal with the reactions of her surprised friends. Imelda Staunton, Anna Chancellor, Kenny Doughty(n)

programme.title: Legal Eagles
programme.desc: A District Attorney and a lawyer become romantically involved as they team up to defend a spaced-out art theft suspect turned murder suspect(n)

programme.title: Unbreakable
programme.desc: Haunting comic book story of a train crash survivor who realises that he has never been hurt and befriends his opposite, a man who has never been free from injury. Thriller(n)

programme.title: Thirteen Conversations About One Thing
programme.desc: Jill Sprecher's film follows five New Yorkers whose lives intertwine, from eternal optimist Alan Arkin to his pessimistic colleague John Turturro, with Matthew McConaughey as a hot-shot lawyer whose life is derailed by a road accident(n)

programme.title: Boiler Room
programme.desc: In this drama that explores greed and corruption in American business, Giovanni Ribisi plays Seth Davis, an intelligent and ambitious college dropout who runs a casino in his apartment. Eager to show his father that he can succeed, Seth lands a job with a small stock brokerage firm. He is given a space in the company's "boiler room," where he makes cold calls to prospective clients. As it turns out, Seth has a genuine talent for cold calling, which gains him the approval of his superiors, the admiration of his father, and the attentions of one of his co-workers, Abby Hilliard (Nia Long). However, the higher up the ladder Seth rises, the deeper he sinks into a quagmire of dirty dealings, until he's breaking the law in order to keep his bosses happy and his paychecks coming. The Boiler Room also features Tom Everett Scott, Scott Caan, Jamie Kennedy, Nicky Katt, and Ben Affleck in a cameo as the headhunter who brings Seth into the firm. Ribisi and Scott also appeared together in That Thing You Do; Ribisi was the drummer replaced by Scott, who then led The One-Ders to fictional pop stardom(n)

programme.title: The Huntsman: Winter's War
programme.desc: This exhilarating spin-off of "Snow White and the Huntsman" acts as both prequel and sequel to the original film, detailing the adventures of Eric the Huntsman as he gets caught up in the rivalry between wicked queens Ravenna and Freya. During his quest, Eric is also endangered by his feelings for fellow warrior Sara, since ice queen Freya has decreed that love is forbidden in her kingdom(n)

programme.title: Slumdog Millionaire
programme.desc: Jamal Malik is one question away from winning 20 million rupees in the Indian version of the TV quiz show Who Wants to Be A Millionaire?. As he answers correctly one question after another, the producers suspect he is cheating and have him arrested. The police agents questioning him cannot believe that a slumdog like him can have the knowledge to win the prize and become a millionaire overnight. While trying to prove them it is destiny that placed him there, Jamal will take us back to the events of his childhood that have the clue to the answers. We will learn about how he and his little brother strived to survive in the mean streets of Mumbai and how he met Latika, his one true love. He entered the show knowing she would be watching it and now every question brings him closer to her(n)

Plagued with debt, writer's block, and fallen far past deadline for his latest play, it seems like things can't get much worse for young William Shakespeare (Joseph Fiennes). programme.title: Modern Marvels
programme.desc: Mad Electricity. By any standard, the Serbian-born scientist-cum-inventor Nikola Tesla (1856-1943) was a man with a vision light years ahead of its time. It may stun modern man, for instance, to learn that Tesla conceived of wireless energy, green power and remote controls decades before any of those concepts became en vogue. As a result of his prescience, Tesla made an enduring impact on contemporary technology, and many of his concepts were still being widely used at the dawn of the 21st Century. As produced by - and originally aired on - The History Channel, the episode of the series Modern Marvels entitled "Mad Electricity" travels inside of Tesla's brilliant mind to examine some of his many discoveries and patents and provide a brief window into his dazzling thought processes. Subtopics include: the now-global standard of alternating electrical current (AC), first employed by Tesla at Niagara Falls in 1893; a site on Long Island sound where Tesla constructed an enormous tower that he hoped would wirelessly power the entire world; Tesla's early advances with solar and geothermal power; and much more. The program draws on interviews with historians, demonstrations of Tesla's inventions, and much more(n)

programme.title: Borat
programme.desc: Master of disguise Sacha Baron Cohen hits the road to explore America as the crude Kazakstani reporter Borat in a feature mockumentary that brings one of the Da Ali G Show star's most popular characters to life on the big screen. Sent by the Kazakh Ministry of Information to gain a better understanding of American culture and bring his findings back home, Borat and faithful producer Azamat (Ken Davitian) set their sights in New York City. When the citizens and interview subjects of the Big Apple seem less than receptive to Borat's distinctively unrestrained approach and the curious Kazakh television personality stumbles across an episode of Baywatch while channel-surfing in his hotel room, he becomes instantly smitten with screen siren Pamela Anderson. Now confident that the only way to discover the true essence of America is to travel to California and make the bikini-clad beauty his bride, Borat purchases a ramshackle ice-cream truck in which he and Azamat will make their way across the Great Plains and on to the sunny West Coast -- all the while coming into contact with a wide variety of "typical" Americans. Within this loose, scripted framework, Borat engages in his usual misbehavior with unsuspecting strangers, from accidentally releasing a chicken from his suitcase on a New York subway ride to a formal interview with Alan Keyes(n)

The daughter of the US President has disappeared into the now-deadly Los Angeles with the crucial black box. Now the President's henchman Malloy demands that Snake go and find her, take the box and then kill her - and Snake can hardly refuse since the penalty for non-cooperation will be death!(n)

Alan and the team take on the challenge of creating a garden that will suit the whole family, and also keep Shelly-Ann's memory alive.(n)

programme.desc: James Martin's culinary journey brings him to the lakeside town of Annecy, where he wanders around the market to select ingredients, before creating dishes making the most of local tomatoes, red mullet and lobster. The chef also pays a visit to the award-winning pastry chef Philippe Rigollot to sample of his extraordinary creations.(n)

programme.title: Rebound
programme.desc: Sean Fletcher hosts the quickfire quiz that tests the general knowledge of six contestants, who go head to head in a bid to walk away with a big cash prize. The players must give as many correct answers as they can in the time it takes the `Rebound Bar' to move across the studio, with the money on offer rising accordingly.(n)

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Game show, hosted by Ben Shephard, in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot.(n)

programme.title: Bear Grylls Survival School
programme.desc: The youngsters must eat maggots found in a rotting dead rabbit, have a scary introduction to snakes and climb an ancient slate wall. There are also challenges within the group as they compete for the role of leader.(n)

programme.title: The Living Daylights
programme.desc: James Bond crosses the continents to help a KGB agent to defect to the West. While protecting him from an unknown assassin, the super-spy is drawn into the world of arms dealing and a plot to trade millions of pounds' worth of diamonds for weapons to supply mercenaries around the world. Action adventure, with Timothy Dalton making his debut appearance as 007, alongside Maryam d'Abo, Joe Don Baker and Art Malik.(n)

programme.title: The Chase

They must work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.(n)

programme.title: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
programme.desc: The young wizard is given the task of uncovering the secrets of Lord Voldemort's past as the evil sorcerer's henchmen cause havoc in both the magical and Muggle worlds. With the help of headmaster Dumbledore, Harry ventures into the memories of those who knew the Dark Lord during his early years, hoping to gain an insight into the secret behind his apparent immortality. However, Voldemort's influence extends much closer to home than expected, as Harry's rival Malfoy is chosen to carry out a sinister mission. Fantasy adventure sequel, starring Daniel Radcliffe, Michael Gambon, Emma Watson, Rupert Grint, Tom Felton and Alan Rickman.(n)

Plus, a gamekeeper who was wrongfully arrested for possessions of amphetamine.(n)

programme.desc: Robert grabs Rich outside his house and gives him a severe beating, leading to an arrest, while Gary is rushed to hospital after suffering an accident at work. Elsewhere, Amy texts Simon informing him that Leanne and Steve are going to get married.(n)

programme.title: American Dad

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: A windfall allows the Griffins to buy a restaurant, but it fails to enjoy much success until Joe invites some of his disabled friends to come along - bringing Peter's prejudices to the fore.(n)

programme.title: The Cleveland Show
programme.desc: Cleveland thanks Tim for getting him a job in his office, but when he proves a natural in the role and becomes top salesman, jealousy threatens their friendship. Meanwhile, Rallo and Roberta help Cleveland Jr be more sensitive.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Marple
programme.desc: Ever since a beautiful American woman arrived in the peaceful village of Wychwood-under-Ashe, people have begun to die in a series of apparent accidents. Nobody suspects a killer is at work but, as the body count rises, Miss Marple digs a little deeper with the help of a former policeman - and they gradually unearth a secret that will rock the village to its core. Murder mystery, starring Julia McKenzie, Benedict Cumberbatch, David Haig, Sylvia Syms, Margo Stilley and Hugo Speer.(n)

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Bellamy chases joyriders tearing through Aidensfield and accidentally runs down Don Dibley's son during the pursuit. The boy's father demands compensation, but soon realises his problems have just begun as his daughter reveals she is pregnant. Steve finds himself in trouble and David invents a novel way to rid the estate of moles. Rural drama, starring Mark Jordon, James Carlton and Ted Robbins.(n)

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: A recently widowed woman arrives in Aidensfield wanting to bury her husband in the family grave, but the deceased's brother refuses to co-operate because of an old feud. Vernon and David get involved and find themselves held at gunpoint as a shocking case of fraud is uncovered. Rural drama, starring Geoffrey Hughes and David Lonsdale.(n)

programme.title: Murder, She Wrote
programme.sub-title: The Dark Side of the Door.
programme.desc: Jessica examines a recent murder which the police are reluctant to investigate, and discovers a link between the killing and an abduction 11 years previously. Angela Lansbury stars.(n)

programme.title: Murder, She Wrote
programme.desc: Disaster strikes on the set of a TV sitcom when the producer is killed in cold blood - leaving Jessica to determine whether one of the show's actors might have done the deed, or if somebody else bears a grudge. Angela Lansbury stars.(n)

programme.desc: Part two of two. Roger returns to Liverpool, while Pop discovers Edith's new boyfriend George is a con-artist defrauding the ministry - and resolves to teach him a lesson. David Jason stars.(n)

programme.title: Columbo: Butterfly in Shades of Grey
programme.desc: A radio presenter is plotting to sabotage his adopted daughter's plans to publish her first novel and kills one of his employees for trying to help her. He thinks he has the perfect alibi, claiming that the victim was murdered while they were talking to each other on the phone, and there is a tape recording to prove it - but his ruse fails to fool the dishevelled detective. Crime drama, with Peter Falk, William Shatner and Molly Hagan.(n)

programme.title: Wycliffe
programme.desc: The detective and his team embark on a race against time to recapture a dangerous convict who has escaped from Bodmin prison - a case that leads them to an elaborate drugs racket. Starring Jack Shepherd, Helen Masters, Jimmy Yuill and Sean Chapman.(n)

programme.title: Foyle's War
programme.desc: When an RAF officer is found hanged in a wood, Meredith - the new chief superintendent at Hastings - is quick to dismiss it as a straightforward suicide. However, an aerial photo of a German village found in the dead man's pocket leads Milner to suspect murder. The newly retired Foyle is compelled to return to service when events take an even more unexpected turn. Wartime crime drama, starring Michael Kitchen.(n)

programme.title: Lewis
programme.desc: Religious fanatic Steven Mullan is found beaten and drowned in his bath. Lewis and Hathaway discover he had been imprisoned for trying to kill well-known atheist Tom Rattan and had only recently been released. The inspector soon has reason to believe the Rattan family is hiding something from him - but nothing prepares him for the evidence Dr Hobson uncovers at the post-mortem. Kevin Whately and Laurence Fox star, with guest appearances by Jenny Seagrove and Julian Wadham.(n)

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Barnaby is delighted that his heroes Hired Gun are reuniting to play at the Midsomer Rocks festival - minus their drummer, who disappeared 30 years ago after driving his car into a quarry. However, a string of bizarre warnings convinces the paranoid lead singer that someone is trying to stop the reunion, and his fears are confirmed when the backing singer drops dead on stage. Radio 2 host Suzi Quatro guest stars.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: UK
programme.desc: Three people are murdered in a shop in central London and a fourth is left for dead, and Brooks and Devlin are up against the clock to find a killer who they fear could strike again. When a suspect is brought to trial, Steel's hopes for a relatively straightforward case are dashed when he finds himself pitted against a brilliant defence lawyer. Crime drama, guest starring Rupert Graves and Amanda Root.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: UK
programme.desc: When police sergeant Pete Garvey is killed, the investigation proves harrowing for Devlin as he was one of his best friends. The detective discovers the officer had recently been in contact with their childhood parish priest Jonathan Nugent, who Pete claimed sexually abused him as a child. Unable to place a straightforward murder charge against Nugent, Steel and Phillips take an unusual approach to bring him to trial. Guest starring Matthew Marsh, Ruth Gemmell and Patrick Malahide, with Jamie Bamber.(n)

programme.title: Wire in the Blood
programme.desc: Part one of two. Tony becomes absorbed in a bizarre chain of murders in which each perpetrator in turn becomes the next victim but the unusual modus operandi of beating, strangulation and shooting - always with the same gun - remains the same. Completely caught up in the case, he fails to pick up dark hints from cannibal Michael, whom he helped to convict, that he is planning to escape from the secure unit where he is held. Thriller, starring Robson Green, with Simone Lahbib and Mark Letheren.(n)

programme.title: Wire in the Blood
programme.desc: Part two of two. The serial killing of men comes to a halt, but the abduction of a widow indicates the perpetrator has broadened his ambitions - and murder is not his only motivation. Psychopath Michael makes good his escape from the secure unit, wearing the clothes of the prison chaplain he duped, and Tony is lined up as his next victim. Drama, starring Robson Green and Simone Lahbib.(n)

programme.title: The Casebook of Sherlock Holmes

Medical drama, starring Martin Shaw, Niamh Cusack and Michael Kitchen.(n)

Hospital drama, starring Martin Shaw, Niamh Cusack, David Harewood and Michael Kitchen.(n)

programme.desc: As the crime drama returns for its 13th and final series, Poirot finds himself investigating the strange and gruesome murder of an elderly psychiatrist. The investigation takes him to the Swiss Alps, where, against all odds, he stumbles upon a hotel thought to be Marrascaud's hideout - leading to a very personal showdown.
