programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: In Bath, Kirstie Allsopp meets first time buyers Laura and Phil, who are desperate to make the move from shared living to a home of their own. Meanwhile, Phil Spencer goes property searching with downsizing duo Kerrie and Dave, who sold their beloved barn conversion to move closer to their kids.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp helps Jacinta and Marco, who have outgrown their home in Didsbury, Greater Manchester, while Phil Spencer assists newly engaged Olivia and Amy, who want to settle back in the North after five years on the move.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Five amateur chefs compete for the £1,000 prize in Kingston upon Thames, south-west London, and keen basketball player Ken Oputa is the first to host, inviting his guests to turn up in sportswear fancy dress. He hopes his Double Dribble mushrooms and Slam Dunk salmon will prove to be winning ingredients.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Interior designer Erika Sager hosts the second dinner party of the week on board her boat in Kingston upon Thames, south-west London, and invites her guests to dress up as pirates. Despite the unconventional setting, her rivals are all impressed by the standard of her food and hospitality.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Mother-of-two Sarah Brice hosts the third dinner party in Kingston upon Thames, hoping to impress her guests with her own take on dishes including prawns, lamb and chocolate mousse. Ken Oputa tries to make an impression on the female contestants with his romantic poetry, but finds Erika Sager switches her attentions to his rival Jamie Baker.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Photographer Jamie Baker hosts the fourth party in London, and his ambitious menu of langoustine and crab ravioli, herb crusted rack of lamb, and milloux of chocolate - combined with his choice of evening entertainment - go down well, until an unexpected turn of events scuppers his plans.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Retired golfer David Witcher hosts the final evening in Kingston upon Thames, south-west London, and hopes to impress with an American-themed menu, including Wyoming slow-cooked ribs and Louisiana seafood chowder. After dinner, he entertains his guests with a bucking bronco, before the winner of the £1,000 prize is announced.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition begins at stately home Anstey Hall in Cambridge, with father and son team John and Johnny de Bruyne. The fun starts with a character-revealing afternoon of goose-herding, before the participants dress to impress at a formal dinner. John recounts stories of royal connections - which fails to impress hotel managers Mark and Layla. In the morning, as they tuck in to a self-service breakfast, guest Tim decides that DIY doesn't work at Anstey Hall, but when he notes this on his feedback form, John and Johnny accuse him of game-playing.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit of the competition is to clothes-free Clover Spa and Hotel in Birmingham, where owner Tim Higgs hopes to convert his rivals to the joys of naturism. Judging with an extra critical eye are John and Jonny De Bruyne, who received negative feedback from Tim, and a thorough room inspection reveals a dusty porn DVD. Tim tries to encourage his nervous guests to take part in a naked spa experience, but John opts to watch television instead. When feedback is invited, Tim is delighted to discover Mark and Layla would stay again but shocked by the `porn film' discovery.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contestants travel to the Angel Hotel in Coleford, Gloucestershire for the third day of the competition, where a treasure hunt organised by hosts Mark and Layla brings out their guests' competitive sides. Meanwhile, there is confusion at breakfast and Layla's manners are criticised.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final stay is at Higher Gitcombe in Totnes, Devon, where owners Paul and Lynnie Jolly set out to spoil their guests. Everyone is overwhelmed by the added extras, but naturist Tim is put off by cushions and clutter. After a masterclass in Nordic walking, Lynnie serves up a veg smoothie, which unhealthy eaters Mark and Layla dubiously down in one. Over dinner, Tim challenges his host's organic 'niche'. And Layla, still smarting from his negative feedback, labels him 'weird, naked Tim'. At breakfast, guests are wary as Tim's order goes wrong and Jonny and Layla engage in an eating competition. When feedback is invited, the Jollys are affronted by accusations of special treatment and vow to put the record straight.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: On the final day of the competition, the owners of Anstey Hall, the Clover Spa and Hotel, the Angel Hotel and Higher Gitcombe meet for the last time to find out what they have been paid and settle some scores. Having aired their issues, the winners are announced.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Driving instructor Ray Dodd hosts the first dinner party in Milton Keynes, Buckinghamshire, but finds his guests a difficult crowd to please. Recruitment executive Michelle Watson turns her nose up at the salmon starter, while choir director Joseph Benneh sends his steak back to the kitchen.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Recruitment executive Michelle Watson welcomes the diners to her home for the second dinner party of the week in Milton Keynes, Buckinghamshire, but the previous night's host Ray Dodd is hungry for revenge following stinging criticism of his efforts. Michelle's cooking also fails to impress Joseph Benneh, so her hopes of scooping the week's prize rest with her choice of entertainment.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Stuart Henson hosts a safari-themed dinner party on the third night in Milton Keynes. He hopes his exotic menu of zebra steak and `elephant dung surprise' will please his guests, but after the insults of the previous night he faces a difficult challenge to persuade his fellow diners to get along.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Choir director Joseph Benneh hosts the fourth dinner party in Milton Keynes, hoping the flavours from his homeland Ghana and a vocal masterclass will prove a winning combination. The guests' expectations are high, so he is under pressure to hit the spot with a menu that includes chicken liver pate, and groundnut soup with coconut rice.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Country enthusiast Susan Rogers hosts the final dinner party in Milton Keynes, Buckinghamshire, hoping her French cuisine will win her extra points. She also demonstrates her skills with an accordion and gives her guests an origami masterclass, before the winner of the £1,000 prize is announced.(n)

programme.title: The Secret Life of the Zoo
programme.desc: Pedro the giant anteater is about to be reunited with long-term mate Bliss, but falls ill and faces a major operation, with an uncertain outcome. Chester Zoo's extremely rare bald ibises produce a batch of new chicks, which are destined to be released back into the wild in southern Spain. There is also a chance to witness the reunion of rhino couple Beni and Asha, who have been kept separate for four years.(n)

programme.title: Father Ted
programme.sub-title: Kicking Bishop Brennan Up the A***.
programme.desc: Cheating in the football match backfires on Ted, prompting his Rugged Island rivals to think up a devilish forfeit - and leaving the priest trying to contrive a way of kicking Bishop Brennan's backside and getting away with it. Comedy, starring Dermot Morgan and Ardal O'Hanlon.(n)

programme.title: Father Ted
programme.desc: Mrs Doyle wins a competition to meet a famous singer, and discreetly invites him round for tea - but the secret slips out, and soon the house is besieged by hordes of adoring pensioners. Comedy, starring Dermot Morgan, Ardal O'Hanlon and Pauline McLynn.(n)

programme.title: It Was Alright In
programme.desc: Matt Lucas narrates a look back at the decade's TV shows, meeting people who appeared in them, those who watched them and their creators. The first of two programmes focuses on pleasure and leisure on 1970s television, with featured clips including outrageous adult jokes in pre-watershed sitcoms, smoking cigarettes on prime-time panel shows, a surprising history lesson aimed at children, and St Bernard dogs being offered for prizes. The footage is also seen through the eyes of people who missed the decade altogether and who find the moral values exhibited to be a real eye-opener.(n)

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts the comedy panel show's version of the famous quiz, with team captains Sean Lock and Jon Richardson joined by guests Miles Jupp and Rhod Gilbert. Countdown regular Susie Dent is in Dictionary Corner with Nick Helm, while Rachel Riley provides the letters and numbers with a little help from comedian Joe Wilkinson.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Consultant Will is concerned about potential spinal and head injuries when 63-year-old Valerie is rushed to St George's after falling from a horse, while 30-year-old Natasha has had an accident while trampolining at her son Taelan's eighth birthday party.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay visits Down City, a restaurant in Providence, Rhode Island. The no-nonsense chef struggles to persuade hot-headed owner Abby to make his suggested changes, and a confrontation results in him being thrown out of the building in the middle of a dinner service. The eatery's co-owner and financier begs Gordon to return, but his success hinges on his ability to win Abby over.(n)

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts the comedy panel show's version of the famous quiz, with team captains Sean Lock and Jon Richardson joined by guests Miles Jupp and Rhod Gilbert. Countdown regular Susie Dent is in Dictionary Corner with Nick Helm, while Rachel Riley provides the letters and numbers with a little help from comedian Joe Wilkinson.(n)

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Uncut
programme.desc: Extended edition. Jack Dee, Kelly Osbourne, Micky Flanagan and Jamelia join team captains Jon Richardson and Sean Lock on the irreverent panel show, hosted by Jimmy Carr. The contestants answer questions based on opinion polls carried out around the country to see who best understands what is going on in Britain today.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Laura Hamilton helps Hampshire sailing enthusiasts Berto and Angie Janssen look for a holiday home for their family in south Tenerife, and discovers the uncertain global economic climate means their budget of £250,000 can go a long way.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Jasmine Harman helps David and Kim France from Preston search for a dream home in Barbados. The couple have a budget of £400,000, and are looking for a property large enough to accommodate their children as well as two sheepdogs.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition heads to the Old Times Guesthouse in Ipswich, where mother-and-daughter duo Linda and Kelly Langdown hope a go-karting session will get the contest off to a flying start. However, a lack of breakfast options and corner-cutting on the guests' orders do not go down very well.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The guests visit the Flower Pot in Sunbury-on-Thames on their second night, where owner Simon Bailey and French manager Pierre Cudon provide stylish continental-inspired accommodation, but the hosts are left puzzled by some of the feedback they receive the next morning.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit is to the family-run Dolphin Hotel in Exmouth, Devon, which has been a life's work for hotelier Jo Knowles. On arrival, Pat and Nigel find a suspicious stain, before the guests put on their war faces for a game of paintball. Jo takes everyone to a floating restaurant for dinner, and the next morning she presents a huge spread for breakfast - but her diners are suspicious that it has been laid on specially for the competition.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contestants stay at the Mariners Beachside B&B in Seaton, Devon, but are disappointed by the cleanliness of the property. They take part in a town-crying competition during the afternoon, and host Nigel feels under pressure to deliver his award-winning breakfast the next morning. Come feedback time, the owners discover not all their guests share the same opinion.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The B&B owners meet for the final time to find out what they have been paid, and confront their rivals. Simon Bailey and Pierre Cudon from the Flower Pot feel the feedback left by Nigel and Pat Booth is a step too far, while the Mariners B&B owners hit back at the men's opinion of their establishment's cleanliness. Linda and Kelly Langdown of the Old Times Guest House question the rating of their facilities, while the Dolphin Hotel's Jo Knowles has a confession to make regarding her hosting.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Jonnie Irwin takes house-hunters Alan and Michele Raine from Sunderland to Orlando to find a family holiday home. With property prices in Florida costing half what they were five years earlier, can Jonnie help them to pick a bargain in the sun?.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Presenter Jasmine Harman has her work cut out as she tries to help Gordon Sandilands and his partner Louisa Hunter find a second home in Murcia, Spain for less than £100,000.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and Mick Aston lead a team investigating the history of Westminster Abbey, battling London's driving rain as they seek to uncover the truth about one of Britain's greatest landmarks. They hope to locate a lost sacristy, rumoured to have held the largest treasure trove to the west of the Alps, but are surprised to find the remains of a row of 18th-century houses and workshops built right up against the Abbey.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.desc: An invitation to excavate the remains of what is thought to be one of Scotland's earliest chapels on the Isle of Mull provides Tony Robinson and the team with one of their biggest, most rewarding, challenges. In a forest outside the town of Tobermory, they believe they have discovered a settlement established by St Columba, who brought Christianity to northern Britain - but the remoteness of the location and the discovery of human remains threaten what could be a once-in-a-lifetime find.(n)

programme.title: Vet on the Hill
programme.desc: A cat with severe breathing problems and a two-year-old Shar Pei dog that has been abandoned and has an eye disease that could eventually blind it if not treated.(n)

programme.title: George Clarke's Amazing Spaces
programme.desc: The architect meets a man who drunkenly bought a 1920s showman's carriage online, but quickly sobered up when he saw the poor condition it was in. He also visits a holiday home constructed from a Second World War vehicle, faces a major setback with his caravan project and follows the build of a beach hut - in Birmingham.(n)

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Mary Martin and Carl Turner want to build a home that resembles a giant stack of glass cubes in Brixton, south London. The couple are hoping the structure will become an instant landmark, while on the inside they are planning a Zen retreat. But to succeed, their finances must be pushed to their limit, so Carl takes on as many of the specialist jobs as he can to save money. Kevin McCloud follows their progress.(n)

programme.title: Volatile Earth
programme.desc: Scientists use the latest forensic techniques to investigate bizarre landscapes in America, Iceland and the floor of the English Channel that might have been caused by huge floods.(n)

programme.title: Japan's Tsunami: How It Happened
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the scientific factors behind the magnitude nine earthquake and the resultant tsunami that struck Japan on March 11, 2011. Professor of geological sciences Roger Bilham views the effects of the devastation from the air, and journalist Callum Macrae travels to the north of the country, where survivors in the fishing villages of Sendai and Ofunato are struggling to cope in the aftermath.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Consultant Will is concerned about potential spinal and head injuries when 63-year-old Valerie is rushed to St George's after falling from a horse, while 30-year-old Natasha has had an accident while trampolining at her son Taelan's eighth birthday party.(n)

programme.title: When Sharks Attack
programme.desc: Panic in Paradise. In April of 2008, the popular tourist destination of Zihuatanejo Mexico is transformed from a safe haven of crystal clear water into one of the most dangerous beaches in the world. The area has never seen a shark attack in its history, but when three surfers are violently attacked, two of them fatally, in less than a month, the town erupts into a panic. As the attacks escalate and the towns vital tourism flounders, the terrified public wonders why the normally safe waters have turned into a blood soaked nightmare? and what will happen to their town if the attacks continue. Its up to scientists to investigate the mysterious attacks and explain whats going on before the town collapses? or the waters claim another victim(n)

Having targeted Geoffrey (Joseph Marcell) as a perfect patsy, Will (Will Smith) and Carlton (Alfonso Ribeiro) pull a series of rather nasty practical jokes on the beleagured butler, topping themselves by convincing Geoffrey that he's won a million-dollar lottery. programme.title: Full House
programme.desc: Bachelor of the Month. When Danny (Bob Saget) is elected San Francisco's "Bachelor of the Month", daughter Michelle (played by the Olsen twins) worries that her dad will be spending so much time socializing that he won't have any room for her. Elsewhere, the pressures of parenthood are already taking quite a toll on Jesse (John Stamos) and Becky (Lisa Loughlin). And Becky's temporary "Wake Up San Francisco" replacement Vicky Larson (Gail Edwards) proves to be a bit too outspoken for her own good--but Danny is fascinated by her all the same(n)

programme.title: Full House
programme.desc: Easy Rider. Intent upon learning how to ride a two-wheel bike, Michelle (played by the Olsen twins) takes a nasty fall--and places the blame on Joey (David Coulier), who was trying to teach her. Meanwhile, Jesse (John Stamos) and Becky (Lisa Loughlin) go on their first outing with the twins, a momentous journey which bids fair to rival Homer's "Odyssey". And Danny (Bob Saget) is having a LOT of trouble maintaining a strictly-business relationship with his temporary TV partner Vicky (Gail Edwards)(n)

Arnott uncovers evidence that a tracker had been planted on one of the convoy vehicles, and when Denton is given special dispensation to visit her dying mother, the AC-12 officers realise too late how much danger she may be in. Drama, starring Keeley Hawes.(n)

programme.title: Chicago PD
programme.desc: The unit investigates the links between a crime lord and a deranged artist who may have been using his skills to create something illegal. Crime drama, starring Jason Beghe and Sophia Bush.(n)

programme.title: The Somme 1916 - From Both Sides of the Wire
programme.desc: Peter Barton concludes his examination of the events of the First World War battle from German and British perspectives by looking at the final months of the campaign, showing how a remarkable German tactical revolution that began in the summer continued to frustrate the Allied advance and extended the entire war far beyond expectations. The historian also argues that the Battle of the Somme ended not in the winter of 1916, but in the spring of 1917, and reaches the conclusion that there was no British victory.(n)

On arrival, he is joined by Danny O'Toole, and the pair take one of two trails to explore the sights, including the Spirit of Place sculpture that was designed by Travis Price. The next day, Dermot meets Gerry McCloskey to explore the south of the island, beginning at Portdoon pier, which was once supposedly a secret base for pirates.(n)

programme.title: Traffic Cops
programme.desc: The officers investigate when a cyclist discovers a man's body in undergrowth, and suspect it may be a hit-and-run case. Elsewhere, tragedy is narrowly averted in north London when a driver under the influence of drink and drugs crashes a stolen vehicle into a bus shelter. Narrated by Jamie Theakston.(n)

programme.desc: Developers Lucy Alexander and Martin Roberts cast their eyes over a property in London, a detached house in Nottinghamshire and a flat in Gateshead, Tyne and Wear.(n)

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.sub-title: DIY SOS: The Big Build: Basildon.
programme.desc: Nick Knowles travels to Basildon, Essex, to meet nine-year-old Brandon, who suffers a severe form of epilepsy and can have up to 30 seizures a day. He requires 24-hour care and mum Jenny can't let him out of her sight for a moment - and to make matters worse, the family home simply isn't safe enough for the youngster. Luckily, the local tradesmen have heard of the family's plight and arrive in force to help Nick and the team transform the home, with designer Naomi Cleaver on hand to ensure they don't stray too far from her vision.(n)

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.sub-title: DIY SOS: The Big Build: Chessington.
programme.desc: Nick Knowles oversees the team renovating a house for members of a family who have spent years living on a building site in Chessington, south-west London. Designer Julia Kendell is on hand to make sure the home is decorated with the latest furnishings and accessories.(n)

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike is tempted by a retro smoking toy he finds in New Hampshire and needs Frank's bargaining skills to ensure a good price.(n)

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike Wolfe and Frank Fritz locate a 1947 Harley-Davidson Knucklehead, and are given VIP access to the untouched stash of a former antiques shop owner.(n)

programme.title: Countryside 999
programme.desc: The Royal Navy Search and Rescue helicopter crew battles bad weather to find three missing mountain climbers. Police deal with traffic offenders on busy country roads, and a rural A&E team attends to an injured farmer. Narrated by Ralph Ineson.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jules Hudson heads to Powys, where a self-employed couple are seeking a more relaxed lifestyle. With a budget of £665,000, they are amazed at how far their money stretches when they view a seven-bedroom Victorian property.(n)

programme.title: The Sheriffs Are Coming
programme.desc: Chris and Steve investigate the case of a British holiday-maker whose trip to Portugal was ruined by a 12-hour delay on his flight home, and the Sheriffs try to help a ski instructor who is owed unpaid wages by the company he used to work for. Plus, Tom and Craig visit a former student still waiting to receive £34,000 from a Chinese education centre, and Pete tries to recoup the money a garage customer spent on a vehicle that turned out to be faulty. Narrated by David Reed.(n)

programme.title: Helicopter ER
programme.desc: The airborne medics face a fight to save a biker's leg after a freak accident, and also tackle a difficult rescue after a farmer falls through rotten floorboards.(n)

programme.title: Secret Eaters
programme.desc: Anna Richardson scrutinises the diets of two Essex sisters who have each piled on the pounds over the past two years. Lauren is training for a marathon but has yet to lose a pound, while Stephanie needs to put a stop to her `grab and go' habits. Once the pair learn the truth about what they are really consuming, will they be able to stick to a healthy eating plan?.(n)

programme.title: Embarrassing Bodies
programme.desc: The doctors set up the portable clinic at the Bristol International Balloon Fiesta, where they give advice on rashes, mouth ulcers and a sweating issue. Also in this edition, Dawn Harper meets a new mother with a painful post-pregnancy problem, Christian Jessen educates festival-goers on flatulence and helps a man whose excessive body hair is playing havoc with his home life, and James Logan investigates the healing power of leeches.(n)

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: Midwife Charlotte arrives on the ward in labour, but despite her desire for a water birth with as little intervention as possible, complications force the plans to be abandoned so the baby can be monitored. Meanwhile, mother-of-two Julie prepares for the arrival of twins, but she may have to change her mind about not using pain relief when one of the babies is found to be lying breech.(n)

programme.title: Babies: Special Delivery
programme.desc: A woman develops pre-eclampsia and another has trouble with her twins.(n)

programme.title: Born to Kill
programme.desc: Psychological profile of Harold Shipman, the Manchester doctor who was convicted in January 2000 of murdering 15 of his patients - though a 2001 Department of Health report estimated he could have been responsible for killing more than 200 others. The programme explores his upbringing and medical career, and examines the possible motivation for his crimes.(n)

programme.title: Born to Kill
programme.desc: A profile of American serial killer Jeffrey Dahmer, who sexually assaulted and killed 17 men in his Milwaukee apartment between the late 1970s and early 1990s. A necrophiliac who also practised cannibalism, he was beaten to death by a fellow inmate in a Wisconsin jail in 1994.(n)

programme.title: Futurama
programme.desc: Fry is beamed aboard a spaceship, only to return the next day without his nose. Leela teams up with a surprise visitor to tackle the aliens responsible, who are intent on plundering the human face.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Strong men are left quaking by the news that alcohol has been made illegal in Springfield. Luckily salvation is at hand in the form of prohibition-busting bootlegger Homer, who brews his own beer to meet demand. Featuring the guest voice of Joe Mantegna.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Bart and Lisa are so disappointed by the latest Cosmic Wars film that they decide to visit creator Randall Curtis at his ranch in California. programme.title: David Attenborough's Galapagos
programme.desc: The broadcaster explores the Galapagos, a collection of volcanic islands in the Pacific known for its extraordinary wildlife. More than 150 years after Charles Darwin formulated his ground-breaking theory of evolution on the remote archipelago, Attenborough explains how life on the islands has continued to evolve in biological isolation, examining how the ever-changing volcanic landscape has given birth to species and sub-species that exist nowhere else in the world. He begins by revealing how Galapagos rose from the ocean four million years ago.(n)

programme.title: Ross Kemp: Extreme World

Superhero adventure, starring Grant Gustin, Iris West, Carlos Valdes, Rick Cosnett and Tom Cavanagh.(n)

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles

programme.title: The Flash

Despite being warned that everything will be weird and wrong, he gets a shock when he runs into the Earth-2 version of Iris and Joe and finds out how he fits into their very different lives. However, nothing prepares the team for meeting evil meta-human team Killer Frost and Deathstorm. Meanwhile, villain Geomancer begins terrorising Central City and it falls to Jay to save the day.(n)

programme.title: Arrow
programme.desc: Count Vertigo escapes from custody and returns to Starling City, where he stirs up trouble by hitting Laurel with a full dose of his disorientating drug, triggering all sorts of fears she has about her sister Sara. As for the rest of the team, tensions simmer when Oliver tries to re-assert his authority, only to discover things have changed in his absence, while Roy warns Thea to steer clear of Malcolm.(n)

programme.title: DC's Legends of Tomorrow
programme.desc: The team is determined to find and rescue Rip, but first must focus on locating the Spear of Destiny and Stein thinks he has the perfect person to help. Meanwhile, Malcom Merlyn and Damien Darhk realise that Thawne is pitting them against each other.(n)

programme.title: The Blacklist
programme.desc: Disturbing events give cause for concern when a series of seemingly non-violent people become killers. As Red and Liz investigate, it appears a dangerous social experiment may be to blame. Meanwhile, Red has a proposition for Naomi and her husband. Paul Reubens (Pee-Wee Herman) guest stars as a criminal fixer.(n)

programme.title: The Force: Essex
programme.desc: Officers investigate a burglary in Basildon and attempt to track down five youths seen fleeing the scene, while police embark on a drug bust.(n)

programme.title: Urban Secrets
programme.desc: Alan Cumming heads across the Irish Sea to Dublin, where he succumbs to the city's famous charm and meets some of its most fascinating characters. On a journey that takes in an 18th-century pleasure house and a burlesque life-painting class, Alan also stops off in Temple Bar for a pint with singer Sharon Corr, unlocks a mystery in Ireland's oldest library and uncovers a stylish secret that lurks behind the steel shutters of an old lock-up.(n)

programme.title: Urban Secrets
programme.desc: Alan Cumming visits Glasgow, one of his favourite cities, to reveal unusual and often hidden sights and sounds overlooked by the public. Starting at the Necropolis, he travels to the world's oldest music hall before enjoying the views from a city-centre landmark. He also finds the time to take tea with a film star.(n)

programme.title: The Guest Wing
programme.desc: Documentary following stately home owners who hire out their estates to earn extra income, and the clients who pay to use their properties for functions including stag parties, weddings and hunting trips. The programme explores how the reality of life in Britain's grand houses is often less glamorous than it appears, as proprietors struggle to maintain crumbling buildings and pay utility bills, and examines the modern-day divide between domestic staff and their employers. Featuring life at Chillingham Castle, Maunsel House, Carlton Towers and Muncaster Castle.(n)

programme.title: The British
programme.desc: How money drove the making of modern Britain, exploring its role in the rebuilding of London following the Great Fire of 1666. The programme investigates how underhanded deals brokered in coffee houses fuelled British prosperity, and exposes how the country profited from dubious practices, including the slave trade, the sex industry and global colonisation. It also explores those who rebelled against the status quo during the period, and discovers how the armed forces countered the threat posed by Napoleon Bonaparte. With contributions by Jeremy Irons, Frank Lampard and Terry Wogan.(n)

programme.title: The British
programme.desc: The expansion of Britain's empire through exploration and invention as the Industrial Revolution transformed society and the economy - though the rise of mechanised factories was not welcomed by all. The programme also explores the colonisation of Australia and the advances in 19th-century technology that turned the Crimean War into one of the most brutal conflicts in military history. With contributions by Jessie J, Lily Cole and Dougray Scott.(n)

programme.title: House
programme.desc: While examining a man with a severely enlarged tongue, House is shot by the husband of a former patient who holds the doctor responsible for his wife's suicide. As the injured medic instructs the team to find the cause of his patient's swelling, he realises his own pain has disappeared - but the operation to remove the bullet appears to have affected his mind as well as his nerves. Guest starring Elias Koteas.(n)

programme.title: House
programme.desc: The medic's staff find two challenging cases for him to investigate on his return to work and are surprised at the apparent change in his usual attitude to his patients. House decides to take both cases on simultaneously and infuriates his staff with his willingness to explore unlikely solutions. Hugh Laurie and Jesse Spencer star.(n)

programme.title: House
programme.desc: A boy is found unconscious on his front lawn. The hospital staff are divided over his claim he was abducted by aliens, with House refusing to accept an extraterrestrial explanation for the youngster's predicament. Struggling to find a solution to the patient's blood-clotting problem and hallucinations, the doctor's depression becomes increasingly acute. Medical drama, guest starring Sheryl Lee (Dirty Sexy Money).(n)

programme.title: Dinosaur 13
programme.desc: In 1990, paleontologist Peter Larson and his team from the Black Hills Institute made one of history's greatest dinosaur discoveries; the largest and most complete Tyrannosaurus Rex fossil ever found. The documentary details the true story behind the discovery, as well as the struggle that surrounded it, including a 10-year battle with the US government, museums, Native American tribes and competing paleontologists.(n)

programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: Danny enters New York's Hasidic community to investigate the murder of the man recently appointed its leader - only to find the victim led a complicated personal life. Jamie arrests the former mayor's daughter for smoking drugs in public, and her bad attitude leaves Erin unable to help her, while Henry upsets Frank by revealing a family secret. Police drama, starring Donnie Wahlberg, Tom Selleck and Bridget Moynahan.(n)

programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: When a 10-year-old boy is shot on a New York housing estate, Danny's heated approach to the case lands him in anger-management classes. The finger of blame is pointed in the direction of the child's father, who later kidnaps his injured son from hospital and Danny must use his sensitivity training to persuade the man to surrender. Meanwhile, Frank has to deal with the State Department and the Turkish government to help a woman avoid persecution and Erin begrudgingly agrees to let Jamie teach Nicky how to drive. Tom Selleck and Donnie Wahlberg star.(n)

programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: Danny investigates the case of a woman who was attacked by her rich and powerful boyfriend. Meanwhile, a friend of Jamie's files a lawsuit against one of Danny's buddies after sustaining an injury during an informal basketball game. Donnie Wahlberg and Will Estes star.(n)

Apprentice deckhand Logan has to decide whether a life at sea is the right choice for him and his family, and seafood seller Jenny receives a surprise on her 65th birthday.(n)

programme.title: Storm City
programme.desc: Documentary in which Ben Fogle explores the devastating impact of extreme weather, finding out what happens when man is pitted against the power of Mother Nature. He begins with the chaos caused by snow and ice, using real-life studies - such as Montreal being shut down by a fierce ice storm in 1998 - and sharing incredible stories of survival. He then subjects a specially built test house to an avalanche, one of the world's deadliest natural forces.(n)

programme.title: Fish Town

programme.title: Richard E Grant's Hotel Secrets
programme.desc: Richard E Grant travels to Venice, said to be the city with the highest concentration of luxury hotels on the planet. He discovers how a measuring error led to the building of the city's biggest swimming pool, tries out a 15,000 euro-a-night royal suite whose bed has been slept in by everyone from the Beckhams to Prince Charles and the Duchess of Cornwall, and visits a hotel that keeps its doors open even when water floods to knee height. He also finds out why breaking a window once earned Ernest Hemingway a 10 per cent discount on his room.(n)

programme.title: Urban Secrets
programme.desc: Alan Cumming examines the hidden histories of cities, revealing the sights and sounds rarely witnessed by the public. programme.desc: The actor learns what it means to be treated like a VIP in some of the world's finest hotels. He heads to the Harlequin Suite at London's Dorchester, where Elizabeth Taylor had a pink marbled bathroom installed. He also visits Paris's Le Meurice, the place Salvador Dali returned to every year for 30 years. He meets the surrealist artist's muse Amanda Lear, who talks about his antics, as well as how his legacy is celebrated in the hotel today. In America, Richard gets a true taste of the lifestyle of the megarich when he orders the $5,000 fleurburger at the Mandalay Bay Hotel in Las Vegas.(n)

programme.desc: The profilers turn the tables on The Replicator, pursuing a lead from a series of murders in Philadelphia. The victims' eyelids have been removed, but the subtle discrepancies between these copycat incidents and the original crimes could hold the key to unmasking the killer. With Scott Grimes (ER).(n)

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: The team investigates a case of life imitating art when several members of an online writing forum are murdered and their tongues are removed. Meanwhile, the profilers are not convinced they have seen the last of The Replicator as several questions about their stalker remain unanswered, and Garcia encounters her ex-boyfriend, stirring Kevin's jealous side.(n)

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: Morgan suspects Carl Buford, the man who molested him as a child, is connected to three murders in Chicago, and as the team struggles to persuade Buford's other past victims to share their stories in the hope of finding clues, the agent is left with no option but to face his abuser in prison to have a chance of solving the case.(n)

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: The team heads to Colorado, where the skull of a missing man has been found during a ceremony to open a time capsule buried 25 years previously. Within hours of the discovery, another victim is decapitated, but has the same killer returned two decades later or is a copycat on the loose?.(n)

programme.title: Limitless
programme.sub-title: Stop Me Before I Hug Again.
programme.desc: Brian is invited on his first FBI field assignment when he is asked to lend his mind and skills to a unit responsible for catching serial killers, but he finds out the renowned criminal profiler he is working with may have put an innocent man behind bars during the case that made his career. Brian also tries to stay ahead of Rebecca as she takes a step closer to discovering Senator Morra's link to NZT.(n)

programme.title: Limitless
programme.desc: A developer at the tech think tank that Brian frequents is murdered, so he and Rebecca interview the robotic version that the victim created of herself for clues to the killer's identity. Plus, Brian screens agents for a position to join Mike and Ike as his third bodyguard.(n)

programme.title: Stop, Search, Seize
programme.desc: Documentary following the work of Ireland's border force officers as they fight to stop gangs of organised smugglers from bringing drugs, money, guns, cars and even exotic animals into the country.(n)

programme.title: UK Border Force
programme.desc: Officers refuse entry to a woman from South Africa who admits her intention is to work illegally to support her family, and a bingo hall in Somerset is raided. Plus, five Iraqis are discovered in the back of a lorry in Calais.(n)

programme.title: Obese: A Year to Save My Life USA
programme.desc: Part one of two. Trainer Chris Powell helps a food-addicted DJ who has said he will lose half his body weight before proposing to his girlfriend.(n)

programme.title: Nothing to Declare
programme.desc: Fly-on-the-wall documentary accessing the world of national security at Australia's biggest airports as customs and immigration officers tackle drug runners, illegal immigrants and terrorists.(n)

Narrated by Lorraine Kelly.(n)

programme.title: Children's Hospital

Narrated by Lorraine Kelly.(n)

programme.title: Cooks to Market

Given £250 each, the teams create their products on a commercial scale and sell them at London's bustling Real Food Market, and whoever makes the greater profit will secure a meeting with a panel of investors. Presented by Gizzi Erskine and James Averdieck.(n)

programme.desc: The helicopter team rushes to a traffic collision involving a motorbike and a van.(n)

programme.title: The Real A&E
programme.desc: The team races to the aftermath of a serious air traffic collision after two aeroplanes are reported missing from radar.(n)

programme.title: Elementary
programme.desc: Holmes is asked to consult on the case of a Wall Street banker who appears to have overdosed on heroin, with work-related stress and a misguided experiment being two possible explanations for the victim's drug use. Meanwhile, Watson tackles the dating game. Detective drama, starring Jonny Lee Miller and Lucy Liu.(n)

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: When severed limbs are discovered dumped on a native American reservation in South Dakota's Rapid City, police try to pass the deaths off as the result of a wolf attack, but the BAU finds ritualistic marks on the remains that suggest otherwise. As the investigation progresses, Reid gives the team cause for concern.(n)

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: The team investigates a murderer who has been abducting and killing childminders on the same day each year, selecting victims from parks across California. As the dreaded anniversary nears, the BAU tracks down a hostage who escaped and may prove essential in finding the culprit.(n)

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: The agents investigate a killer targeting married couples, and the inconsistent stab wounds lead them to believe the victims are being forced to harm each other. Meanwhile, Alex's suspicions are aroused when her husband returns from overseas. With DW Moffett (Friday Night Lights).(n)

programme.title: Licence to Drive
programme.desc: A teenager promises the girl of his dreams he will take her out in his grandfather's treasured vintage car, even though he has just failed his driving test - leading to a whole host of mishaps and scrapes. Comedy, starring Corey Haim, Corey Feldman, Carol Kane and Heather Graham.(n)

programme.title: The Naked Gun 33 1/3: The Final Insult
programme.desc: Inept police detective Frank Drebin plans to retire from the force, but is lured back by the opportunity to foil a terrorist plot. Going undercover in prison, he sets out to prevent an evil mastermind from escaping and carrying out his fiendish plan - to bomb the Oscar awards ceremony. Comedy sequel, starring Leslie Nielsen, Priscilla Presley, OJ Simpson, George Kennedy and Fred Ward.(n)

Family comedy, starring Tom Hanks, Mare Winningham and Craig T Nelson.(n)

Romantic comedy written by Richard Curtis, starring Hugh Grant, Julia Roberts, Rhys Ifans, Emma Chambers, James Dreyfus and Gina McKee.(n)

programme.title: Absolutely Fabulous: The Movie
programme.desc: After accidentally knocking Kate Moss into the Thames, hapless champagne-swigging friends Patsy and Edina are hounded by the paparazzi. Comedy based on the BBC sitcom, starring Jennifer Saunders, Joanna Lumley and Julia Sawalha.(n)

programme.title: Keanu
programme.desc: When thugs steal Keanu the cat, two mild-mannered cousins pose as deadly assassins to get the beloved feline back. Action comedy, starring Jordan Peele, Keegan-Michael Key and Tiffany Haddish.(n)

programme.title: In Her Shoes
programme.desc: Two sisters have little in common - one is a financially irresponsible flirt and the other is a mature and staid lawyer. However, the pair are brought together when a dark family secret comes to light. Curtis Hanson's comedy drama, based on a novel by Jennifer Weiner, starring Cameron Diaz, Toni Collette and Shirley MacLaine.(n)

programme.title: Sisters
programme.desc: Two estranged sisters are reunited when their parents decide to sell the house they grew up in. They return to the family home to clear out their childhood bedrooms, but with their parents away, seize the chance to relive their teenage years and throw one last wild house party. Comedy, starring Amy Poehler, Tina Fey and Dianne Wiest.(n)

programme.title: Absolutely Fabulous: The Movie
programme.desc: After accidentally knocking Kate Moss into the Thames, hapless champagne-swigging friends Patsy and Edina are hounded by the paparazzi. Comedy based on the BBC sitcom, starring Jennifer Saunders, Joanna Lumley and Julia Sawalha.(n)

programme.title: Keanu
programme.desc: When thugs steal Keanu the cat, two mild-mannered cousins pose as deadly assassins to get the beloved feline back. Action comedy, starring Jordan Peele, Keegan-Michael Key and Tiffany Haddish.(n)

programme.title: The Bad Education Movie
programme.desc: Incompetent teacher Alfie Wickers decides his students deserve a treat for somehow passing their GCSEs, so decides to take them on the greatest school trip of their lives - to Cornwall. However, a series of disasters leaves the class into trouble with suspicious locals. Comedy, starring Jack Whitehall, Harry Enfield and Iain Glen.(n)

programme.title: Death at a Funeral
programme.desc: A family gather to bury the patriarch, but any dignity to the occasion soon disappears in a run of disasters. The deceased's oldest son resents the success of his younger brother, while their sister's boyfriend has accidentally taken LSD and an unexpected guest has a few shock revelations to make. Comedy, with Chris Rock, Martin Lawrence, Zoe Saldana and Peter Dinklage.(n)

programme.title: The Benchwarmers
programme.desc: Three losers who have been pushed around all their lives decide to finally stand up for themselves and rebuild their self-esteem. With the backing of a millionaire, they form their own baseball team and take part in a tournament - in which all the other competitors are children. Sporting comedy, starring Rob Schneider, Jon Heder, David Spade and Jon Lovitz.(n)

programme.title: The Grass Is Greener
programme.desc: An English earl is forced to open his stately home to the public to avoid going broke. When one of the tourists, an American tycoon, takes an interest in his wife, the peer enlists the aid of an old flame to save his marriage. Romantic comedy, starring Cary Grant, Deborah Kerr, Robert Mitchum and Jean Simmons.(n)

programme.title: The Top Ten Show
programme.desc: Clips from the UK and US Top Ten show you the best of what's on offer on the big screen.(n)

programme.title: Lost in Karastan
programme.desc: A director struggling with personal and professional crises attends a film festival in a newly-formed republic, and accepts an offer from the country's dictator to make a film about one of their national heroes. The shoot soon descends into chaos when his leading man goes missing and his benefactor is overthrown in a military coup. Comedy, starring Matthew Macfadyen, MyAnna Buring and Noah Taylor.(n)

programme.title: Police Academy
programme.desc: An American police college lowers its entrance requirements in the hope of attracting new recruits, and in response, assorted dubious candidates turn up for enrolment. A short-tempered instructor is determined to weed out the bad apples, but a riot provides the clueless cops with a chance to prove their worth. Comedy, starring Steve Guttenberg, Kim Cattrall, Bubba Smith and GW Bailey.(n)

programme.title: How to Lose Friends & Alienate People
programme.desc: A self-promoting writer is offered a position on the staff of a New York fashion magazine thanks to his irreverent views on the world of celebrity. However, he soon discovers his opinions render him incapable of relating to the superficial personalities he is expected to work with, not to mention his egotistical boss. Comedy based on Toby Young's memoirs, starring Simon Pegg, Kirsten Dunst, Jeff Bridges, Megan Fox and Gillian Anderson.(n)

programme.title: Ghostbusters
programme.desc: When a series of supernatural disturbances occur in New York city, a quartet of investigators and their dim assistant investigate. Reboot of the 1980s comedy franchise, starring Kristen Wiig, Melissa McCarthy, Kate McKinnon, Leslie Jones and Chris Hemsworth.(n)

programme.title: Spider-Man: Homecoming: Special
programme.desc: The making of the new Marvel superhero movie, which sees Tom Holland as the friendly neighbourhood Spider-Man, taking on Michael Keaton's Vulture with the help of Iron Man.(n)

programme.title: Hot Pursuit
programme.desc: An uptight, accident prone police officer desperate to prove herself has to protect a gangster's widow who has agreed to give evidence against a drug lord. They end up forced to go on the run together, and are pursued across Texas by hitmen and corrupt cops. Crime comedy, starring Reese Witherspoon and Sofia Vergara.(n)

programme.title: Barbershop: A Fresh Cut
programme.desc: As their surrounding community has taken a turn for the worse, the crew at Calvin's Barbershop come together to bring some much-needed change to their neighbourhood. Comedy, starring Ice Cube, Cedric the Entertainer and Regina Hall.(n)

programme.title: Vacation
programme.desc: Family man Rusty Griswold spent his childhood family holidays stumbling from one disaster to another with his hapless father. He is determined that his own road trip with his wife and kids will go better - but soon finds the apple has not fallen far from the tree. Sequel to the 1980s comedy series, starring Ed Helms and Christina Applegate, with Chevy Chase and Beverly D'Angelo reprising their roles.(n)

programme.title: Ghostbusters
programme.desc: When a series of supernatural disturbances occur in New York city, a quartet of investigators and their dim assistant investigate. Reboot of the 1980s comedy franchise, starring Kristen Wiig, Melissa McCarthy, Kate McKinnon, Leslie Jones and Chris Hemsworth.(n)

programme.title: The Love Bug
programme.desc: Herbie, an irrepressible Beetle car with a mind of its own, takes a shine to a struggling racing driver and leads him to victory on the track. However, his success attracts the attention of an unscrupulous rival competitor, who will go to any lengths to win the most important race of all. Disney comedy, starring Dean Jones, Michele Lee, Buddy Hackett and David Tomlinson.(n)

programme.title: Pocahontas
programme.desc: A Native American princess falls in love with an English settler, but her father is distrustful of the Europeans - not without just cause, as a cruel governor is prepared to wage war to get his hands on the gold he believes they are hiding. Disney animated drama, with the voices of Irene Bedard, Mel Gibson and Christian Bale.(n)

programme.title: Piper
programme.desc: Animated Pixar short, directed by Alan Barillaro. A mother bird tries to teach her little one how to find food for herself, but encounters a traumatic experience.(n)

programme.title: The Jungle Book
programme.desc: A boy is raised by animals in the jungles of India, but his carefree life is threatened by the return of a fierce tiger with a grudge against humans. The youngster faces a difficult choice between remaining with his friends or returning to his own people. Live action remake of Disney's animated adventure based on Rudyard Kipling's stories, starring Neel Sethi, with the voices of Bill Murray, Ben Kingsley and Idris Elba.(n)

programme.title: Beauty and the Beast
programme.desc: A bookish woman agrees to take her father's place as prisoner of a fearsome monster living in a castle deep in the forest. She gradually grows to see a gentler, more human side to her hideous host, and comes to realise she may be able to break the curse that turned him into a beast in the first place. Disney animated fantasy, with the voices of Paige O'Hara and Robby Benson.(n)

programme.desc: Animated short comedy from Pixar about a magician preparing for a performance who once again forgets to feed his rabbit before going on stage. However, the animal has had enough of going hungry and plots to ruin the show. Directed and voiced by Doug Sweetland.(n)

programme.title: Bambi
programme.desc: A young deer grows up in the forest, forming close friendships with other woodland creatures. When tragedy strikes, he is suddenly forced to fend for himself but ultimately becomes brave and resourceful enough to save his friends during a forest fire. Animated drama, with the voices of Bobby Stewart, Hardie Albright and Donnie Dunagan.(n)

programme.title: Pocahontas
programme.desc: A Native American princess falls in love with an English settler, but her father is distrustful of the Europeans - not without just cause, as a cruel governor is prepared to wage war to get his hands on the gold he believes they are hiding. Disney animated drama, with the voices of Irene Bedard, Mel Gibson and Christian Bale.(n)

Disney animated adventure sequel, featuring the voices of Irene Bedard, Jim Cummings, Donal Gibson and Judy Kuhn.(n)

programme.title: Beauty and the Beast

Disney animated fantasy, with the voices of Paige O'Hara and Robby Benson.(n)

programme.title: Riley's First Date
programme.desc: Emotions run high when a boy shows up at the front door asking for Riley. Pixar short featuring the characters from Oscar-winning animation Inside Out, with the voices of Kyle MacLachlan, Diane Lane and Kaitlyn Dias.(n)

programme.desc: The swashbuckling rogues join forces with old foe Barbossa to take on villainous Lord Beckett. Fantasy adventure sequel, starring Johnny Depp, Geoffrey Rush, Orlando Bloom, Keira Knightley and Chow Yun-Fat, and featuring a cameo appearance by Keith Richards.(n)

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: A bumbling, short-sighted senior citizen unwittingly ends up in the possession of a valuable jewel during a mix-up at a museum exhibition, and is blissfully unaware that a Brazilian crime lord, a female cat burglar and the FBI are on his tail. Comedy based on the cartoon series, starring Leslie Nielsen, Kelly Lynch, Malcolm McDowell, Ernie Hudson and Jennifer Garner.(n)

programme.title: Rascal
programme.desc: A boy growing up in Wisconsin is frequently left alone following his mother's death, as his travelling salesman father spends most of the time away from home. The youngster comes across a baby raccoon that has been abandoned by its family, and the animal becomes his constant companion. Fact-based family drama, starring Bill Mumy and Steve Forrest.(n)

programme.title: The Absent-Minded Professor
programme.desc: An eccentric inventor creates a lighter-than-air substance and uses it to make his car fly, attracting the attention of an unscrupulous spy ring. Disney fantasy comedy, starring Fred MacMurray, Tommy Kirk and Nancy Olson.(n)

programme.desc: The two children of a missing sea captain receive a message in a bottle that convinces them their father is still alive. Enlisting an eccentric French professor to help them find him, they embark on round-the-world journey and face natural disasters and mutineers during the voyage. Children's adventure based on a novel by Jules Verne, starring Maurice Chevalier, Hayley Mills and George Sanders.(n)

programme.title: Bambi
programme.desc: A young deer grows up in the forest, forming close friendships with other woodland creatures. Animated drama, with the voices of Bobby Stewart, Hardie Albright and Donnie Dunagan.(n)

programme.desc: Sequel to the Disney animation, in which Copper the dog joins a country music band of strays. However, his taste of fame leads him to neglect old friend Tod the fox. With the voices of Patrick Swayze, Reba McEntire, Harrison Fahn and Jonah Bobo.(n)

programme.title: Underdog
programme.desc: A mad scientist kidnaps a beagle to use as a guinea pig in his deranged experiments. But an accidental injection leaves the mutt with awe-inspiring superpowers, which he uses to foil the deranged inventor's plans to take over a city. Comedy adventure, starring Peter Dinklage and James Belushi, and featuring the voices of Jason Lee and Amy Adams.(n)

programme.title: Zootropolis
programme.desc: In a city populated by animals, a rabbit achieves her dream of becoming the first bunny to become a police officer - but faces prejudice at every turn. When the disappearance of an otter hints at a terrible conspiracy in the city, she enlists the aid of a con-artist fox in solving the mystery. Disney animated comedy, with the voices of Ginnifer Goodwin, Jason Bateman and Idris Elba.(n)

programme.title: Inside Out
programme.desc: Inside 11-year-old Riley's head lives a team of five that controls her emotions. Led by the eternally upbeat Joy, they have always ensured she lived a happy life - but when Riley's parents move to a new city, she is plunged into depression and the emotions face a crisis that threatens their entire world. Pixar animated fantasy, with the voices of Amy Poehler and Phyllis Smith.(n)

programme.title: Pooh's Grand Adventure: The Search for Christopher Robin
programme.desc: Christopher Robin starts school and leaves a note for Winnie the Pooh explaining why he will not be around any more. However, the bear misunderstands the message and becomes convinced his friend is in grave danger, organising the other animals into a rescue attempt. Animated adventure, with the voices of Jim Cummings and John Fiedler.(n)

programme.title: Underdog
programme.desc: A mad scientist kidnaps a beagle to use as a guinea pig in his deranged experiments. But an accidental injection leaves the mutt with awe-inspiring superpowers, which he uses to foil the deranged inventor's plans to take over a city. Comedy adventure, starring Peter Dinklage and James Belushi, and featuring the voices of Jason Lee and Amy Adams.(n)

When the disappearance of an otter hints at a terrible conspiracy in the city, she enlists the aid of a con-artist fox in solving the mystery. Disney animated comedy, with the voices of Ginnifer Goodwin, Jason Bateman and Idris Elba.(n)

programme.title: The Finest Hours
programme.desc: An oil tanker suffers devastating damage while caught in a fierce Atlantic storm, which breaks the vessel in two. While an engineer tries to keep the crew members trapped in the sinking wreckage alive, members of the Coast Guard brave the deadly conditions to come to their rescue. Fact-based disaster movie, starring Chris Pine, Casey Affleck and Eric Bana.(n)

programme.title: My Favorite Martian
programme.desc: A TV journalist meets a stranded alien who is trying to repair his crashed spacecraft. After first planning to exploit the chance of a big story, he instead offers his help after befriending the visitor - but a fellow reporter plans to expose the truth. Sci-fi comedy based on the 1960s TV series, starring Christopher Lloyd, Jeff Daniels, Elizabeth Hurley and Daryl Hannah.(n)

programme.title: The Shaggy DA
programme.desc: A boy who once turned into a dog grows up to become a principled lawyer, who runs for district attorney. However, as he campaigns against the crooked current DA, he finds himself once again undergoing a canine transformation and must find out the cause while keeping his condition a secret. Sequel to Disney comedy The Shaggy Dog, starring Dean Jones and Suzanne Pleshette.(n)

programme.title: Superman IV: The Quest for Peace
programme.desc: The Man of Steel embarks on a mission to destroy every nuclear weapon on the planet. However, his arch-enemy Lex Luthor sees the chance to rid himself of the superhero by creating a deadly radioactive henchman who causes havoc around the world. Comic-book adventure sequel, starring Christopher Reeve, Gene Hackman, Mark Pillow and Margot Kidder.(n)

programme.title: Walking Tall
programme.desc: A former member of the US Army Special Forces returns to his home town, only to find the pleasant rural backwater he once loved has become a criminal haven. Determined to restore order, he sets out to take down those responsible for the town's decline. Action adventure remake of the cult 1973 film, starring Dwayne Johnson, Johnny Knoxville, Neal McDonough and Kristen Wilson.(n)

programme.title: The Bourne Identity
programme.desc: A fishing boat crew plucks a man out of the sea with two bullet wounds in his back and a safe-deposit number sewn into his skin - but absolutely no memory of who he is or how he got there. In the search for his true identity, he is pursued by assassins - but his skill at evading them suggests his own past is far from straightforward. Thriller, starring Matt Damon, Franka Potente, Chris Cooper, Clive Owen and Brian Cox.(n)

programme.title: I Am Legend
programme.desc: A Manhattan-based military scientist finds himself immune to a virus that turns humans into ferocious vampire-like creatures. After the disease has swept across the world, wiping out an estimated 90 per cent of the human population, he devotes his solitary existence to finding a cure by unlocking the secret within his blood. Sci-fi thriller, starring Will Smith, Alice Braga and Charlie Tahan.(n)

programme.title: King Arthur
programme.desc: A Roman commander is posted to Britain in the last days of the empire and given a final mission to rescue a high-ranking official and his son stranded in the north. However, the endeavour reveals his true destiny is to lead the Britons against the new Saxon invasion, and marks the start of a legend. Historical adventure, starring Clive Owen, Keira Knightley, Ray Winstone, Ioan Gruffudd and Stephen Dillane.(n)

programme.title: The Day the Earth Stood Still
programme.desc: An alien arrives on Earth, accompanied by an awesomely powerful robot, on a fateful mission - to decide if the human race deserves to continue - and if not, to wipe it out. The visitor is imprisoned in a military facility, but a scientist helps him escape, hoping to prove that mankind is worth saving. Sci-fi drama remake, starring Keanu Reeves and Jennifer Connelly.(n)

programme.title: Rocky II
programme.desc: Philadelphia boxer Rocky Balboa quits the ring to marry his sweetheart and become a father. However, times prove hard and money is tight, so when Balboa is offered another shot at Apollo Creed's heavyweight title, the fighter is lured out of retirement. Drama sequel, starring Sylvester Stallone, Talia Shire, Carl Weathers, Burt Young and Burgess Meredith.(n)

programme.title: The Bourne Identity
programme.desc: A fishing boat crew plucks a man out of the sea with two bullet wounds in his back and a safe-deposit number sewn into his skin - but absolutely no memory of who he is or how he got there. In the search for his true identity, he is pursued by assassins - but his skill at evading them suggests his own past is far from straightforward. Thriller, starring Matt Damon, Franka Potente, Chris Cooper, Clive Owen and Brian Cox.(n)

programme.title: The Italian Job
programme.desc: A crook double-crosses his partners in crime, a betrayal that leaves their friend and mentor dead. One year later, they regroup and come up with a daring plan to exact revenge on the traitor and reclaim their ill-gotten gains. Crime thriller inspired by the 1969 movie, starring Mark Wahlberg, Charlize Theron, Edward Norton, Seth Green and Donald Sutherland.(n)

programme.title: I Am Legend
programme.desc: A Manhattan-based military scientist finds himself immune to a virus that turns humans into ferocious vampire-like creatures. After the disease has swept across the world, wiping out an estimated 90 per cent of the human population, he devotes his solitary existence to finding a cure by unlocking the secret within his blood. Sci-fi thriller, starring Will Smith, Alice Braga and Charlie Tahan.(n)

programme.title: Face/Off
programme.desc: FBI agent Sean Archer captures terrorist Castor Troy, the man who killed his son. While Troy is in a coma, Archer has the crook's face surgically grafted onto his own so he can go undercover and locate a bomb planted somewhere in Los Angeles. But then Troy regains consciousness - and in turn takes on Archer's identity. John Woo's action thriller, starring Nicolas Cage, John Travolta, Joan Allen, Gina Gershon and Dominique Swain.(n)

programme.title: Underworld
programme.desc: A vampire fights a war against werewolves that has raged for centuries, with the human race oblivious to the conflict. She falls in love with a mortal man who has wandered unwittingly into the midst of a conflict, and must protect him from both the enemy, who have plans for him, and her own side. Supernatural action thriller, starring Kate Beckinsale, Scott Speedman, Michael Sheen and Bill Nighy.(n)

programme.title: Return of the Seven
programme.desc: The leader of a gang of bandits enslaves all the men from a Mexican village while maddened with grief over the death of his son. However, one of his hostages is a survivor from the original team of gunfighters, and his wife persuades his two remaining companions to form a new band of heroes and mount a rescue mission. Western sequel, starring Yul Brynner, Robert Fuller and Warren Oates.(n)

programme.title: Green Zone
programme.desc: A military officer is sent to Iraq after the downfall of Saddam Hussein on a mission to find the weapons of mass destruction that were used to justify the invasion - only to be warned by a CIA agent that no such devices exist. As he continues his fruitless search, he discovers evidence of a political conspiracy. Paul Greengrass's thriller, starring Matt Damon, Greg Kinnear and Brendan Gleeson.(n)

programme.title: I Am Wrath
programme.desc: A grieving widower is shocked when his wife's killers manage to evade justice, so he seeks the aid of an old friend in taking the law into his own hands. However, as he hunts down the murderers, he discovers they have friends in very high places. Crime thriller, starring John Travolta and Christopher Meloni.(n)

programme.title: Armageddon
programme.desc: Nasa discovers an asteroid the size of Texas is on a collision course with Earth, so a drilling expert is recruited to train a team of misfits to transport a nuclear device into outer space to destroy it - but having had no experience of space travel, the reluctant astronauts find themselves seriously out of their depth. Sci-fi thriller, with Bruce Willis, Ben Affleck, Liv Tyler, Michael Clarke Duncan, Billy Bob Thornton and Steve Buscemi.(n)

programme.title: The Bourne Supremacy
programme.desc: The amnesiac assassin is living quietly in hiding, until his former employers come after him again and murder his girlfriend. A CIA operation has ended in disaster, and those responsible intend to clear their names by implicating Bourne. As the former secret agent tries to evade the hitmen on his trail, he also struggles to piece together the truth about his past. Action thriller sequel, starring Matt Damon, Brian Cox, Joan Allen and Julia Stiles.(n)

programme.title: Stealth
programme.desc: Three highly skilled fighter pilots are less than thrilled when a new computer with artificial intelligence is brought in to assist in flying a state-of-the-art jet. However, the trio are left to pick up the pieces when the machine is struck by lightning and begins to malfunction, leading to a chaotic battle to stop the jet from starting an all-out war. Action adventure, starring Jamie Foxx, Jessica Biel and Josh Lucas.(n)

programme.title: Rocky III
programme.desc: World heavyweight boxing champion Rocky Balboa settles down into a life of luxury - but a cloud appears on the horizon in the shape of ambitious contender Clubber Lang, whose brutal fighting style represents a serious threat to his title. Drama, starring Sylvester Stallone, Mr T, Burgess Meredith, Talia Shire, Burt Young, Carl Weathers and Hulk Hogan.(n)

programme.title: Green Zone
programme.desc: A military officer is sent to Iraq after the downfall of Saddam Hussein on a mission to find the weapons of mass destruction that were used to justify the invasion - only to be warned by a CIA agent that no such devices exist. As he continues his fruitless search, he discovers evidence of a political conspiracy. Paul Greengrass's thriller, starring Matt Damon, Greg Kinnear and Brendan Gleeson.(n)

programme.title: Armageddon
programme.desc: Nasa discovers an asteroid the size of Texas is on a collision course with Earth, so a drilling expert is recruited to train a team of misfits to transport a nuclear device into outer space to destroy it - but having had no experience of space travel, the reluctant astronauts find themselves seriously out of their depth. Sci-fi thriller, with Bruce Willis, Ben Affleck, Liv Tyler, Michael Clarke Duncan, Billy Bob Thornton and Steve Buscemi.(n)

programme.title: The Bourne Supremacy
programme.desc: The amnesiac assassin is living quietly in hiding, until his former employers come after him again and murder his girlfriend. A CIA operation has ended in disaster, and those responsible intend to clear their names by implicating Bourne. As the former secret agent tries to evade the hitmen on his trail, he also struggles to piece together the truth about his past. Action thriller sequel, starring Matt Damon, Brian Cox, Joan Allen and Julia Stiles.(n)

programme.title: Deep Family Secrets
programme.desc: A girl sets out on a personal quest to discover the truth about her mother's alleged abduction, and uncovers a tangled tale of adultery, incest and murder. Thriller, starring Richard Crenna, Angie Dickinson and Meg Foster.(n)

programme.title: The Smuggler
programme.desc: The police intercept a suspected drugs mule they believe has swallowed condoms filled with heroin on his re-entry to his native Australia. He can only be charged after the illicit substance is ejected by his body - so he spends the next week incarcerated with the authorities keeping an eye on his every movement. Comedy drama, starring Hugo Weaving, Angus Sampson and Leigh Whannell.(n)

programme.title: Fast & Furious
programme.desc: News of a friend's murder brings international fugitive Dominic Toretto back to his home city of Los Angeles in search of revenge. It is not long before his pursuit leads him to cross paths with FBI agent Brian O'Conner, and despite their hostile feelings toward each other, the pair work together to bring down those responsible. Thriller sequel, starring Vin Diesel, Paul Walker, Michelle Rodriguez and Jordana Brewster.(n)

programme.title: Captive
programme.desc: A fugitive fleeing from a police manhunt is desperate to see his newborn son. Needing a hiding place, he takes a recovering meth addict hostage in her own home. The pair make an unlikely connection as they bond over finding ways to cope with the challenges in their lives. Fact-based drama, starring Kate Mara and David Oyelowo.(n)

programme.title: Bad Boys II
programme.desc: Two mismatched undercover cops set out to halt an underground gang war and bring down a drug lord attempting to flood the market with a deadly form of Ecstasy. However, a romantic interlude threatens to drive the investigation off course. Comedy thriller sequel, starring Will Smith, Martin Lawrence, Gabrielle Union, Jordi Molla and Peter Stormare.(n)

programme.title: War Dogs
programme.desc: Twentysomething gun runners David Packouz and Efraim Diveroli win a $300million contract from the Pentagon to arm America's allies in Afghanistan. Fact based comedy-drama, starring Miles Teller, Jonah Hill and Bradley Cooper.(n)

programme.title: Fast & Furious
programme.desc: News of a friend's murder brings international fugitive Dominic Toretto back to his home city of Los Angeles in search of revenge. It is not long before his pursuit leads him to cross paths with FBI agent Brian O'Conner, and despite their hostile feelings toward each other, the pair work together to bring down those responsible. Thriller sequel, starring Vin Diesel, Paul Walker, Michelle Rodriguez and Jordana Brewster.(n)
