programme.title: Nothing Like the Holidays
programme.desc: Puerto Rican siblings reunite for Christmas amid the impending divorce of their parents(n)

programme.title: Vanishing Wilderness
programme.desc: Rex Allen narrates this study of the flora and fauna of North America's least spoiled areas: northern Alaska and the Arctic, Florida's Everglades and the Pacific Northwest. Animals seen in their natural habitats include alligators, beavers, pelicans, sea otters, bighorn sheep, grouse and polar bears. Directed by Arthur Dubs and Heinz Seilmann(n)

programme.title: Animal Mechanicals
programme.desc: Mechana Cuckoo Clock Island. The Mechana Cuckoo Clock needs to be fixed(n)

programme.title: Ice Age: The Meltdown
programme.desc: In this hilarious sequel, Manny, Sid, and Diego discover the Ice Age is ending, and join everybody to journey to higher ground. En route they discover Manny isn't the last woolly mammoth(n)

programme.title: Bo on the Go!
programme.desc: Bo and the Blockhead. Bo and Dezzy try to stop Blockhead from building a tower of blocks(n)

programme.title: Busytown Mysteries
programme.desc: Lighthouse Ghost Mystery; Cornfield Confusion. Hilda Hippo claims to see a ghost near the old lighthouse; Pig Won't gets lost in a cornfield(n)

programme.title: Doodlebops Rockin' Road Show
programme.desc: Deedee's Doodle; Bus Driver Bob. A drawing comes to life and begins to terrorize a town; the Doodles learn to share the spotlight when their bus driver gains the attention of an interviewer(n)

programme.title: The Zula Patrol
programme.sub-title: The Probe Who Came to Dinner; Forget-Me-Naut
programme.desc: The Probe Who Came to Dinner; Forget-Me-Naut. The Zuleans send a space probe to a newly discovered planet just as one from that planet arrives on Zula; Dark Truder secretly abducts Bula and replaces him with a robot(n)

programme.title: The Adventures of Abney & Teal
programme.desc: Stuck. Animated adventures of two friends who live on an island in the middle of the big city. They share their home with a group of friendly and hilarious characters. Everyone is very busy on the Island. Abney is decorating the trees and Teal has found an old tyre to do tricks with. The tyre gets stuck around Bop's tummy and Teal, Abney, Neep and the Poc-Pocs have to think what to do(n)

programme.title: Garfield: A Tail of Two Kitties
programme.desc: When Jon follows his girlfriend Liz to London, intending to propose, lasagne-loving cat Garfied and his pal Odie stow away in Jon's bag. While sightseeing Garfield is mistaken for a regal cat called Prince, who looks just like him. He's taken to Prince's castle, where evil Lord Dargis tried to get rid of him and claim the castle. There's lots of feline fun as the identity swap causes chaoes, but there's a happy ending for animals and humans in this star-studded second full-length movie starring the lovable but lazy cat(n)

programme.title: Big
programme.desc: A 13-year-old boy wants to be "big," and his wish is granted by a mechanical fortuneteller at a traveling carnival. After seeing what it is to live in an adult world, he wants his old life back and has to find the same wizard to reverse his wish(n)

programme.title: The Twilight Zone
programme.desc: Third from the Sun. Director Richard L. Bare made an impressive Twilight Zone debut with this classic episode. Fritz Weaver and Joe Maross star respectively as scientist William Sturka and test pilot Jerry Riden, who, aware that their country is on the brink of nuclear war, conspire to rescue themselves and their families by blasting off in an experimental spaceship. But first, the fugitives-to-be must escape the watchful eye of odious government functionary Carling (Edward Andrews). Though the episode's punch line is tipped off by its title, "Third from the Sun" scores points with some truly remarkable camerawork, courtesy of director Bare and cinematographer George Clemens. Scripted by Rod Serling from a short story by Richard Matheson, this episode first aired January 8, 1960(n)

programme.title: The Twilight Zone
programme.desc: The Hitchhiker. A cross-country driver (Inger Stevens) is haunted by a persistent hitchhiker (Leonard Strong) who appears wherever she goes. Sailor: Adam Williams. Mechanic: Lew Gallo. Counterman: Russ Bender. Waitress: Mitzi McCall. Mrs. Whitney: Eleanor Audley. Road Worker: Dwight Townsend. Garage Man: George Mitchell(n)

programme.title: The Twilight Zone
programme.desc: The Fever. A reluctant Vegas vacationer (Everett Sloane) can't stop playing after his first slot-machine pull is a winner. Flora: Vivi Janiss. Publicity Agent: William Kendis. Drunk: Art Lewis. Script by Rod Serling(n)

programme.title: Mutant World
programme.desc: A group of doomsday preppers emerge from their bunker 10 years after an apocalyptic meteor strike, only to discover that crazed mutants have overtaken the world(n)

programme.title: Carrie

programme.title: 30 Days of Night
programme.desc: The small Alaskan town of Barrow is so far north, it suffers 30 days of full darkness... Which is ideal for a band of vampires, led by Marlow, who descend on the town to feast. Local sheriff Eben Oleson and his estranged wife Stella lead a small group of survivors who hole up in a secret lair but, with supplies running out and the vampires closing in, can they stay hidden or must they risk taking on the undead? David Slade's all-action, visceral horror film mixes fast-moving action with claustrophobic tension as the body count rises and the days slowly pass. Premiere(n)

programme.title: Legion

programme.title: Horns

Meanwhile, Rachel (Jennifer Aniston) girds up her courage to read The Shining (provided that Joey [Matt LeBlanc] can wade through Little Women). programme.title: Batman Begins
programme.desc: As a young boy, Bruce Wayne watched in horror as his millionaire parents were slain in front of him--a trauma that leads him to become obsessed with revenge. But the opportunity to avenge his parents' deaths is cruelly taken away from him by fate. Fleeing to the East, where he seeks counsel with the dangerous but honourable ninja cult leader known as Ra's Al-Ghul, Bruce returns to his now decaying Gotham City, which is overrun by organised crime and other dangerous individuals manipulating the system. Meanwhile, Bruce is slowly being swindled out of Wayne Industries, the company he inherited. The discovery of a cave under his mansion, along with a prototype armoured suit, leads him to assume a new persona, one which will strike fear into the hearts of men who do wrong; he becomes Batman!!!(n)

programme.title: MLB Baseball

Monica receives a tip from an admirer worth a small fortune; and a hypnosis tape that's meant to help Chandler give up smoking has a strange effect on him(n)

But a pirate always has another trick, and along with a crew in which he shouldn¿t trust, Jack will pursue the darkest treasure: a heart that can save him from the curse. Second episode of Pirates of the Caribbean saga(n)

programme.title: Married...With Children
programme.desc: The D'Arcy Files. In this spoof of The X-Files, a mysterious stranger (Robert Mandan) offers Al (Ed O'Neill) $50,000 to help him locate Jefferson D'Arcy (Ted McGinley)--not exactly a daunting assignment, since Jefferson has been living next door to Al for nearly two years. And the reason behind the Stranger's interest? Well, it might be that Jefferson was telling the truth to his wife Marcy (Amanda Bearse) when he claimed that he was once an espionage agent and master of disguise (Peter Lawford was one of his best "covers"!)(n)

programme.title: Married...With Children
programme.desc: Nooner or Later. In order to win a radio contest staged by deejay Rick Dees (as himself), Peg (Katey Sagal) must persuade Al (Ed O'Neill) to come home from work early for a hot-and-heavy "nooner." While all this is going on, Kelly (Christina Applegate) and Bud (David Faustino) languish in a long line for B.B.R. concert tickets. Appearing as Dexter is Chi McBride of Boston Public and The Nine fame(n)

programme.title: Married...With Children
programme.desc: Ride Scare. Initially resistant to joining a carpool, Al proves more receptive when his travelling companions turn out to be a trio of toothsome lingerie models (Jane Abbott, Shannon K. Dunn, Debra Christofferson). Things take a sharp turn for the worse when Al and the girls are chosen to represent a "Clean Up Chicago" campaign. Meanwhile, "Verminator" Kelly (Christina Applegate) somehow wins the Employee of the Month award. Watch for a throwaway gag involving unlamented former regular Shane Sweet--not to mention a lengthier perusal of onetime Penthouse model Sandra Korn(n)

Also, Ross (David Schwimmer) finally decides to dump his bald-domed girlfriend, Bonnie (Christine Taylor), while Rachel (Jennifer Aniston) writes Ross an impassioned letter. And in a development related to the episode's title, Joey (Matt LeBlanc), Chandler (Matthew Perry), and Monica (Courteney Cox) come up with a unique and rather stupid method to cure their jellyfish bites(n)

While there, Donna is horrified to find out that Robert Rodriguez is screening a Blaxploitation film that she starred in when she was younger. Elsewhere Cleveland Jr, tired of Comic-Con being a playground for Hollywood to peddle their projects, gathers a band of geeks together to take the convention back to its true origins(n)

programme.desc: Hauntening. As the Belchers ready for Halloween, Louise reveals that she's never been scared by anything, so the family pays a visit to a spooky haunted house, where things start going bump in the night(n)

programme.desc: Gayle Makin' Bob Sled. Bob's big Thanksgiving plans and festivities are put on hold when he has to go pick up an injured Gayle and on the way home gets stuck in the middle of a surprise snowstorm. As a result, the holiday and the fate of the turkey fall to Linda(n)

programme.title: Bob's Burgers

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Valentine's Day in Quahog. Valentine's Day proves promising for the residents of Quahog as Meg hits it off with a guy she met on the Internet, Stewie's time machine transports him to the 1960s, where he falls for a young lady, and Peter and Lois spend the day in bed. Meanwhile, Brian is visited by a bevy of old girlfriends who help him get in touch with his feminine side(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Chris Cross. Unable to foot the bill for new sneakers, Chris lifts some cash from Lois' purse, but is caught red-handed by Meg, who then blackmails him into doing all her chores in exchange for not turning him in. Chris is soon fed up with the arrangement and takes off to live with Herbert(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Call Girl. When financial woes compel Lois to get a job, she's discovered by a voiceover talent agent who hires her for a well-paying gig at an adults-only phone line, where she's rather surprised when one of her callers turns out to be Peter(n)

programme.title: My Friend Irma Goes West
programme.desc: A singer's television appearance catches the eye of a Hollywood producer, who offers him a contract. Delighted, he heads to California with a group of his friends, only to get mixed up with gangsters in Las Vegas, and find that the movie mogul is not what he seems. Comedy, starring Dean Martin and Jerry Lewis.(n)

programme.title: Man from Sonora
programme.desc: A former Texas ranger discovers a gang of bandits terrorising a Florida town are secretly in the employ of a wealthy stable owner, who stands to get even richer when the outlaws' victims need to borrow money from him. However, before the ranger can expose the truth, he ends up in jail thanks to a phoney lawman. Western, starring Johnny Mack Brown and Phyllis Coates.(n)

programme.title: Revolt at Fort Laramie
programme.desc: The cavalry soldiers stationed at Fort Laramie are divided when the Civil War breaks out. The commander and the other Southerners stationed there decide to resign and head off to join the Confederates - but in order to do that, they will have to embark on a perilous journey through Sioux territory. Western, starring John Dehner and Gregg Palmer.(n)

programme.title: Sugarfoot
programme.desc: A former Confederate officer moves to Arizona hoping to start afresh. He is unable to put the past behind him when he finds his new home town lorded over by a couple of old enemies who have been harbouring a grudge against him since the Civil War. Western, starring Randolph Scott, Adele Jergens, Raymond Massey and SZ Sakall.(n)

programme.title: The Law and Jake Wade
programme.desc: A reformed outlaw becomes a US marshal, but veers off the straight and narrow when he is persuaded to break a former crony out of jail. The crook then repays the lawman by kidnapping his fiancee to force him to reveal where he hid the loot from the last robbery they pulled together. Western, starring Robert Taylor, Richard Widmark, Patricia Owens and Robert Middleton.(n)

programme.title: Fort Vengeance
programme.desc: Two fugitive brothers flee from the US into Canada, where they start a new life as Mounties. While one becomes respected as a law enforcer, the other soon resorts to his criminal ways. Western, starring James Craig, Rita Moreno and Keith Larsen.(n)

programme.title: Gun Glory
programme.desc: A reformed gunfighter returns to his home town, only to find it has been taken over by a ruthless cattle baron. Western, with Stewart Granger, Rhonda Fleming, Chill Wills, James Gregory and Steve Rowland.(n)

programme.title: The Big Trees
programme.desc: An unscrupulous timber baron is determined to get his hands on some land heavily forested with redwoods and owned by a small Quaker community. However, he has a change of heart when he falls in love with one of the Quaker women, and has to contend with other less principled rivals who are also after the land. Romantic drama, starring Kirk Douglas, Eve Miller, Edgar Buchanan and Patrice Wymore.(n)

programme.title: Night Raiders
programme.desc: A federal marshal investigates a series of baffling burglaries, in which cabins have been broken into but nothing has been stolen. programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: D-Girl. In this opening episode of Law & Order's first (and thus far only) three-part story, a female Hollywood studio executive is found murdered -- and decapitated -- in New York City. Detectives Briscoe (Jerry Orbach) and Curtis (Benjamin Bratt) head to Tinseltown to check out the suspects, among them the dead woman's abusive ex-husband, Eddie Newman (Scott Cohen), and shady personal trainer Evan Grant (Jeffrey D. Sams). Meanwhile, assistant D.A.'s McCoy (Sam Waterston) and Ross (Carey Lowell) work overtime to make sure that Briscoe and Curtis are not overstepping their jurisdictional bounds(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Turnaround. Part 2 of three. As the case of the movie-studio president's killing continues, it appears that the wrong suspect has been arrested; and Ross must face her ex, who's the new suspect's defense attorney. Newman: Scott Cohen. Grant: Jeffrey D. Sams. Gorton: Keith Szarabajka(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Showtime. As the three-parter concludes, the suspect gets his day(s) in court, but several events serve to complicate matters. Among them: Gorton suing Ross for custody of their daughter. Gorton: Keith Szarabajka. Newman: Scott Cohen. Joyner: Franchelle Stewart Dorn(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Mad Dog. No sooner has serial rapist Lewis Darnell (Burt Young) been released on parole than a young woman is assaulted and murdered. Assistant D.A. McCoy (Sam Waterston) is determined to connect Darnell with this most recent outrage and to put him behind bars permanently. Unfortunately, McCoy's zeal leads to accusations of undue "strongarm" methods on the part of detectives Briscoe (Jerry Orbach) and Curtis (Benjamin Bratt)(n)

programme.title: Money Talks
programme.desc: Action and fast talking comedy abounds as motormouth Chris Tucker stars alongside Charlie Sheen as an escaped convict being chased by the police and a gang of diamond thieves. Franklin Hatchett is a small-time con man exposed by investigative reporter James Russell . When Hatchett becomes unwittingly involved in a jail break, the police think the escape was his idea. Not knowing where to hide, he calls the reporter and makes a deal: he will provide Russell with the exclusive story when he turns himself in, providing that Russell shelters him for the weekend. With a plan so simple, what could possibly go wrong?(n)

programme.desc: We Like Mike. A man is shot down and killed while apparently trying to change a tire. programme.title: Charmed
programme.desc: Wendigo. Tipped off by a man (Billy Jayne) whose fiancée has been killed in a grisly manner, Andy (T.W. King) teams with FBI agent Fallon (Jocelyn Seagrave) to hunt down the Wendigo, a vicious creature who tried to attack Piper (Holly Marie Combs). Alas, it soon develops that the hunted beast is a lot closer than Andy had ever imagined. Meanwhile, Prue's (Shannen Doherty) efforts to keep the auction house afloat may be jeopardized by one of Phoebe's (Alyssa Milano) most unsettling visions -- this one involving a "dead" kidnap victim who may still be alive(n)
